Tab buttons

Standard

Disabled

Small

JS & CSS dependency:

For tab buttons components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

You can also group buttons together to form button groups. This is done by wrapping the buttons to be grouped in a container with the class btn-group. You can also add n-tab-buttons to enable tab button behavior: 



    <div class="btn-group n-tab-buttons">
        <button class="btn btn-standard">Button</button>
        <button class="btn btn-standard">Button</button>
    </div>
     <div class="btn-group n-tab-buttons">
        <button class="btn btn-standard" disabled>Button</button>
        <button class="btn btn-standard" disabled>Button</button>
    </div>
    <div class="btn-group n-tab-buttons">
        <button class="btn btn-small">Button</button>
        <button class="btn btn-small">Button</button>
    </div>

Note that you can use disabled buttons and call to action versions of buttons with button groups as well.

Alert

Information alerts can be used to display errors or other messages with prominence.

Something has gone terribly wrong.
We might have a problem somewhere.
Operation finished successfully. This long text is for testing purposes to demonstrate a really really really long text that wraps at some point to another line in the message area.
No tick icon at the end of the alert, not closing this alert. Here is some long text to demonstrate behavior in text wrap situation.
This can be closed by the tick at the end of this alert.
Option to make alert without the close option.

JS & CSS dependency:

For alert components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.alert.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

To use alerts, wrap the alert message in a container marked with the class alert. You can further specialize the alert by using alert alert-error, which will result in an error alert with red text and a bold font. You can add a custom Nokia icon to symbolize the type of the alert, i.e. a warning icon or an information icon by using icons like <span class="icon icon-info"></span> (options are icon-ok, icon-warning, icon-info, icon-error). 


    <!-- Standard alert -->
    <div class="alert">
        <span class="icon icon-info"></span>We might have a problem somewhere
        <a href class="n-close" data-dismiss="alert" role="button" aria-label="Alert close button">
            <span class="icon icon-close" aria-hidden="true"></span>
        </a>
    </div>

    <!-- Error alert -->
    <div class="alert alert-error">
        <span class="icon icon-error"></span>Something has gone terribly wrong.
        <a href class="n-close" data-dismiss="alert" role="button" aria-label="Alert close button">
            <span class="icon icon-close" aria-hidden="true"></span>
        </a>
    </div>

    <!-- Dismissable alert -->
    <div class="alert alert-error alert-dismissible">
        <span class="icon icon-error"></span>This can be closed by the tick at the end of this alert.
        <a href class="n-close" data-dismiss="alert" role="button" aria-label="Alert close button">
            <span class="icon icon-close" aria-hidden="true"></span>
        </a>
    </div>

Balloon

Click the links / buttons below to get the balloons visible (another click will hide it):

This is for demonstrating default behavior.
This is for demonstrating forced direction balloon behavior in button:
Demonstrating forced top balloon behavior.

Demonstrating balloon with fadeout in certain time behavior.

Example of long text and close icon inside the balloon.
Example of a really long long long long long long long long explanation

Testing balloon with info button (short text).
Short text
Testing info button with icon a bit more (short text).
Testing info button support hover operation with icon a bit more (short text).

JS & CSS dependency:

For balloon components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/wulf.tooltip.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/wulf.balloon.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

Invoke Balloon.js by Required JS

    
    <script src="../assets/js/require.js"></script>
    <script src="../assets/js/require-config.js"></script>
    <script>
        require(['jquery', 'wulf_umd']);
    </script>

Via Javascript

Call the balloon control via JavaScript:

    
    $('[data-toggle="balloon"]').nBalloon();

Example

Basic balloon message:

    
    <a class="link" href data-toggle="balloon" data-placement="bottom auto" data-content="explanation text">text</a>

Balloon with close icon:

    
    <div>
        <a id="myballoon" data-toggle="balloon" data-placement="bottom" data-target-selector="#myballoon_text"
            href="javascript:void(0);" class="balloon-icon">balloon</a>.
            <div id="myballoon_text" class="hidden">
                <div class="icon-popover-text">Short text
                    <a href="javascript:void(0)" class="n-close">
                        <span class="icon icon-close" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close">
                            <span aria-hidden="true"></span>
                        </span>
                    </a>
                </div>
            </div>
    </div>

Info icon with tooltip and balloon:

    
    <div>
        Testing info button
        <a class="link" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="Displays file information">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-info" data-container="body" data-placement="bottom auto"
            data-toggle="balloon" href="javascript:void(0)" data-html="true"
            data-content="
                <dl>
                <dt style='clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;'>File name:</dt>
                <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;" >BTS profile_file.file</dd>
                <dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;"> </dt>
                <dt style="clear:left;">Technologies</dt>
                <dt style="clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;" data-reactid=".r.4">GSM:</dt>
                <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;"><span>0</span>
                <span> TRXs</span></dd><dt style="clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;">LTE:</dt>
                <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;"><span>1</span><span> Cells</span></dd>
                <dt style="clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;" >WCDMA:</dt>
                <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;"><span >1</span><span> Cells</span></dd>
                <dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;" data-reactid=".r.a"> </dt>
                <dt style="clear:left;" data-reactid=".r.b">System modules</dt>
                <dd>FSMF</dd><dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;"> </dt>
                <dt>Radio modules</dt>
                <dd>FRGP, FRGS, FXEB</dd><dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;" > </dt>
                <dt>Extension modules</dt>
                <dd>FBBC</dd></dl>
            " title="">
            </button>
        </a>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script>
        $(function () {
            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            $('[data-toggle="balloon"]').nBalloon();
        })
    </script>

Balloon fadeout feature:

    
    <div>
        Demonstrating
        <a class="link fadeout" data-placement="bottom" data-toggle="balloon" href="javascript:void(0)"
           data-content="Balloon is a small popup area with title, instruction text and possibly icons">
            balloon
        </a> with fadeout in certain time behavior.
    </div>

Tips

1. Data-placement can be: top | bottom | left | right + also empty + optionally also auto to allow automatic positioning on the opposite side near screen edges.

2. Please note that Nokia GUI rule is to limit the size of tooltip to ONLY 2 lines.

Breadcrumb

MANAGEMENT TEAMGLOBAL CUSTOMERS
MANAGEMENT PERSON

JS & CSS dependency:

    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.breadcrumb.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    

    <!-- Breadcrumbs -->

    <a href="#" class="n-breadcrumb-link">Breadcrumb normal</a><i class="n-breadcrumb-icon"></i>
    <a href="#" class="n-breadcrumb-link n-breadcrumb-link-active">Actived breadcrumb</a>

Button

Regular buttons

JS & CSS dependency:

For button components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

You can use a number of different Nokia-style buttons by adding a btn class definition to a button element. A number of different button sizes are provided through additional size classes like btn-large, btn-standard and btn-small. 


    <button class="btn btn-large">Button</button>
    <button class="btn btn-standard">Button</button>
    <button class="btn btn-small">Button</button>
    <button class="btn btn-standard" disabled>Button</button>

Buttons dark

You can also use a dark version of the buttons by adding the btn-action class to the button element. These buttons are stylistically distinctive to encourage the user to take action. 


    <button class="btn btn-action btn-standard">Button</button>
    <button class="btn btn-action btn-standard" disabled>Button</button>

Not print buttons

You can add .btn-not-print for button if you don't want it to be shown when printing.

<button class="btn btn-large btn-not-print">Button</button>

Special buttons

In addition to the regular buttons, you can also choose from a few different special buttons for common use cases, such as closing, minimizing,accessing help and displaying information. These buttons do not require any additional markup other than adding a class like btn-close, btn-minimize, btn-help or btn-info : 


    <button class="btn btn-close"></button>
    <button class="btn btn-minimize"></button>
    <button class="btn btn-help"></button>
    <button class="btn btn-info"></button>

Note that these buttons are defined by appereance only and they do not provide any functionality by themselves. You should use JavaScript if you wish to define functionality for the buttons.

Button without text

You can use a icons inside buttons as well by including a span element with the icon definition. To make sure that the button dimensions are correct, add the btn-icon class to the button: 


    <button class="btn btn-icon">
        <span class="icon icon-settings"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-icon" disabled>
        <span class="icon icon-refresh"></span>
    </button>

If you wish to include also text alongside an icon in the button, make sure to wrap your text content in a span to ensure proper padding between the elements: 


    <button class="btn btn-icon">
        <span class="icon icon-bubble"></span>
        <span>Buttons with icons</span>
    </button>

Default Button

You can turn a button to default button. To make sure that the button dimensions are correct, add the btn-defaultBlue class to the button: 


    <button class="btn btn-standard btn-defaultBlue">
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-close btn-defaultBlue">
        <span class="icon icon-close"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-icon btn-defaultBlue">
        <span class="icon icon-bubble"></span>
    </button>

Comment Button

Note: Comment button normal and hover states differ from OT3.1. 


    <button class="btn btn-icon btn-comment" data-toggle="button">
        <span class="icon icon-message"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-icon btn-comment" data-toggle="button" disabled>
        <span class="icon icon-message"></span>
    </button>

Star Flag

Note: Star flag differs from OT3.1. 


    <button class="btn btn-icon btn-star-primary" data-toggle="button">
        <span class="icon icon-star"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-icon btn-star-primary" data-toggle="button" disabled>
        <span class="icon icon-star"></span>
    </button>

Carousel buttons

Chrome style Carousel button usage: 

    
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-chrome-back">
        <span class="icon icon-back"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-chrome-next">
        <span class="icon icon-next"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-chrome-back" disabled>
        <span class="icon icon-back"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-chrome-next" disabled>
        <span class="icon icon-next"></span>
    </button>;

Standard style carousel button usage (Note: icons do not follow OT3.1): 

    
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-standard btn-carousel-standard-back">
       <span class="icon icon-left"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-standard btn-carousel-standard-bullet">
        <span class="icon icon-bullet"></span>
    </button>
    <button class="btn btn-carousel-standard btn-carousel-standard-next">
        <span class="icon icon-right"></span>
    </button>

    <!-- if you want different colors please patch the styles like bellow
    .btn-carousel-standard .icon:before{
        color: #ffffff;
    }
    .btn-carousel-standard:hover:not(:focus) .icon:before,
    .btn-carousel-standard:focus .icon:before,
    .btn-carousel-standardactive .icon:before
    {
        color: #ffffff;
    }
    .btn-carousel-standard:focus,
    .btn-carousel-standard:active
    {
        border: 3px solid #ffffff;
    }
    .btn-carousel-standard-bullet:hover:not(:focus) .icon:before
    {
        text-shadow: 0 0 7px #ffffff;
    }
    .btn-carousel-standard:hover:not(:focus){
        border: 3px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5)
    } -->

Show details

Details button usage: 

  
      <button class="btn btn-icon btn-details">
      <i class="icon icon-arrow"></i>
      </button>
      <button class="btn btn-icon btn-details">
      <i class="icon icon-arrow-up"></i>
      </button>
      <button class="btn btn-icon btn-details" disabled>
      <i class="icon icon-arrow"></i>
      </button>

Checkbox

JS & CSS dependency:

For Checkbox components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../assets/css/demo.css" rel="stylesheet">
You get disabled checkbox by adding class disabled inside the input tag. Originally checked one you get by adding class checked inside the input tag. To get small checkboxes use class checkbox checkbox-small instead of checkbox. 

    <!-- Group of checkboxes -->
    <div class="form-group">
        <label>Label for checkbox group:</label>
        <div class="checkbox">
            <input id="xx" type="checkbox"></input>
            <label for="xx"> Name of the checkbox </label>
        </div>
    </div>



    <!-- Tri-state checkboxes -->
    <li class="checkbox">
        <input type="checkbox" id="tristatecheck">
        <label for="tristatecheck">Value 1</label>
        <ul>
            <li>
                <input type="checkbox" name="short-1" id="short-1">
                <label for="short-1">Smurf 1</label>
            </li>
        </ul>
    </li>

    Additionally some javascript is required to the tri-state, see this checkbox.html file for that.

Combobox with scrollbar

Combo box textfield

Combo box menu

  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Separated link
  • Separated link
  • Separated link
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Something else here
  • Something else here
  • Separated link

JS & CSS dependency:

For Combo box with scrollbar components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/<
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.combobox.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/<
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/<
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tooltip.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/<

    <!-- Combobox scroll (textfield) -->
    <label for="combo1" class="control-label">Standard:</label>
    <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox" data-initialize="combobox" id="myCombobox">
        <input id="combo1" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
            <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right n-dropdown-menu-scroll>
                <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
                <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Combobox scroll filter(textfield) -->
    <label for="comboFilter" class="control-label">Standard:</label>
    <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox combobox-filter" data-initialize="combobox" id="myComboboxFilter">
        <input id="comboFilter" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
            <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right n-dropdown-menu-scroll>
                <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
                <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <script>
        $('#myCombobox').combobox();
        $(document).ready(function () {
            $('ul.dropdown-menu.dropdown-menu-right li').click(function () {
                $('ul.dropdown-menu.dropdown-menu-right li').removeClass('selected');
                $(this).addClass('selected');
            });
            $(".n-dropdown-menu-scroll").nScrollbar();
        });
    </script>

    <!-- The default value of combobox menu height is 150px. You can change the height by definition of follow style -->
    .n-dropdown-menu-scroll{
        height: 200px !important;
    }

Combo box

Combo box textfield

  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • One Thousand Two Hundred Thirty
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • One Thousand Two Hundred Thirty

  • Three

Combo box menu

  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Separated link for long menu content
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link

JS & CSS dependency:

For Combo box components, it will be ok to import following css file :
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.combobox.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tooltip.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

For getting the disable combo textfield, add disabled at the end of both input and button elements.

For more information about this component, see FuelUX documentation about Combobox.

If want to pre-select something, add class selected to that particular li item.


    <!-- Combobox (textfield) -->
    <label class="control-label">Standard:</label>
    <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox" data-initialize="combobox" id="myCombobox">
        <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
            <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right">
                <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
                <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Disabled combobox (textfield)-->
    <label class="control-label label-disabled">Disabled:</label>
    <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox" data-initialize="combobox" id="myCombobox">
        <input type="text" class="form-control" disabled>
        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" disabled><span class="caret"></span></button>
            <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right">
                <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- With disabled items combobox (textfield) -->
    <label class="control-label">With disabled items:</label>
    <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox" data-initialize="combobox" id="myCombobox">
        <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
            <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right">
                <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
                <li data-value="2" class="disabled" ><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Clear button combobox (textfield)-->
    <div class="form-group">
        <label class="col-sm-5 control-label" style="width: 180px">Clear button:</label>
        <div class="col-sm-8">
            <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox n-cancel-button" data-initialize="combobox">
                <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield" placeholder="Text">
                <a class="n-clear-button-icon hide-element" href="javascript:void(0)">
                    <span role="button" aria-label="clear content" class="icon icon-close"></span>
                </a>
                <div class="input-group-btn">
                    <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown">
                        <span class="caret"></span>
                    </button>
                    <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right" role="menu">
                        <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
                        <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
                        <li data-value="3"><a href="#"><span>Three</span></a></li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script src="./wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <script>
        $('#myCombobox').combobox();
        $(document).ready(function () {
            $('ul.dropdown-menu.dropdown-menu-right li').click(function () {
                $('ul.dropdown-menu.dropdown-menu-right li').removeClass('selected');
                $(this).addClass('selected');
            });
        });
    </script>

For getting the small combo button version, add n-combo-btn-small as a class into the top div and for the label use control-label-sm. For getting the disabled combo button, add disabled at the end of button element and for label add label-disabled. For getting the contextual menu combo button, use contextual-menu-label instead of selected-label. If want to pre-select something, add class selected to that particular li item. 


    <!-- Combobox (menu) -->
    <label class="control-label">Standard:</label>
    <div class="btn-group n-combobutton" data-initialize="selectlist" id="mySelectlist">
        <button type="button" class="btn n-combobutton-btn" data-toggle="tooltip" aria-expanded="false"><span class="selected-label"></span></button>
        <button type="button" class="btn dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false">
            <span class="caret"></span>
            <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
        </button>
        <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu">
            <li><a href="#"><span>Action</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Another action</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Something else here</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Separated link</span></a></li>
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Disabled combobox (menu)-->
    <div class="btn-group n-combobutton" data-initialize="selectlist" id="mySelectlist">
        <button type="button" class="btn n-combobutton-btn" data-toggle="tooltip" disabled><span class="selected-label"></span></button>
        <button type="button" class="btn dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false" disabled>
            <span class="caret"></span>
            <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
        </button>
        <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu">
            <li><a href="#"><span>Action</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Another action</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Something else here</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Separated link</span></a></li>
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Contextual Menu combobox (menu)-->
    <div class="btn-group n-combobutton" data-initialize="selectlist" id="mySelectlist">
        <button type="button" class="btn n-combobutton-btn" data-toggle="tooltip" ><span class="contextual-menu-label">Contextual Menu</span></button>
        <button type="button" class="btn dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false">
            <span class="caret"></span>
            <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
        </button>
        <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu">
            <li><a href="#"><span>Action</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Another action</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Something else here</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="#"><span>Separated link</span></a></li>
        </ul>
    </div>
    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <script>
        $(document).ready(function () {
            $('ul.dropdown-menu.dropdown-menu-right li').click(function () {
                $('ul.dropdown-menu.dropdown-menu-right li').removeClass('selected');
                $(this).addClass('selected');
            });
        });
    </script>

Drawer

JS & CSS dependency:

For drawer components, it will be ok to import following css file :
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.flyout.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

Drawer is a flyout menu. So we use flyout markup data-markup="flyout". It opens from the bottom of screen. So we set the direction as top (expanse to top) data-direction="top".

We can integrate it with tab component. The tab should point to the content with id: <a href="#content"> and <div id="content">. 


    <div class="n-flyout n-drawer" data-markup="flyout" data-direction="top" data-expand="false">
        <ul class="n-flyout-open n-drawer-tabs">
            <li>
                <a href="#one"><span class="topleft"></span><span class="border-container">Tab one</span></a>
            </li>
            <li>
                <a href="#two"><span class="topleft"></span><span class="border-container">Tab Two</span></a>
            </li>
            <li>
                <a href="#three"><span class="topleft"></span><span class="border-container">Tab Three</span></a>
            </li>
            <li>
                <a href="#four"><span class="topleft"></span><span class="border-container">Tab Four</span><span class="topright"></span></a>
            </li>
        </ul>
        <div id="one" class="n-flyout-container">
            one
        </div>
        <div id="two" class="n-flyout-container">
            Tab two content
        </div>
        <div id="three" class="n-flyout-container">
            Tab three content
        </div>
        <div id="four" class="n-flyout-container">
            Tab four content
        </div>
        <div class="drawer-toggle-up"></div>
        <div class="drawer-shadow"></div>
    </div>
  • Add Apps
  • Tab Two
  • Tab Three
  • Tab Four

JS & CSS dependency:

For drilldown without arrow components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.table-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.drilldown.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>


    <div id="table-demo-container" class="col-md-6">
        <table class="n-table n-table-standard n-table-striped n-table-hover n-drilldown-table">
            <thead>
                <tr>
                    <th class="n-sortable">With icon</span>
                    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                    </th>
                    <th class="n-sortable">With text</span>
                    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                    </th>
                    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With error/alert
                    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
                    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With number<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
                </tr>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
                <tr class="n-drillDown-row" data-target-selector="#row1">
                    <td class="text-center"><span class="icon icon-fault-critical"></span></td>
                    <td>Critical fault</td>
                    <td class="n-cell-error text-right">2010</td>

<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.drilldown.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>


    <!-- Basic drillDown -->
        <div id="table-demo-container" class="col-md-6">
        <table class="n-table n-table-standard n-table-striped n-table-cell-hover n-drilldown-table">
            <thead>
                <tr>
                    <th class="n-sortable">With icon</span>
                    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                    </th>
                    <th class="n-sortable">With text</span>
                    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                    </th>
                    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With error/alert
                     <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
                    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With number<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                    </th>
                </tr>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
                <tr>

                    <td class="text-center"><span class="icon icon-fault-critical"></span></td>
                    <td data-target-selector="#item1"><span>Critical fault</span></td>
                    <td class="n-cell-error text-right n-drillDown-item" data-target-selector="#item2">
                    <span>2010</span></td>
                    <td class="text-right n-drillDown-item" data-target-selector="#item3"><span>910</span></td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td colspan="4">
                    <div>
                    <div class="n-drillDown-collapsed" id="item1">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-arrowContainer">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-arrow"></div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-drillDown-content">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-inner">Example1</div>
                    <span class="icon icon-close-rounded"></span>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-drillDown-collapsed" id="item2" >
                    <div class="n-drillDown-arrowContainer">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-arrow"></div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-drillDown-content">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-inner">Example2</div>
                    <span class="icon icon-close-rounded"></span>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-drillDown-collapsed" id="item3">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-arrowContainer">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-arrow"></div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-drillDown-content">
                    <div class="n-drillDown-inner">Example3</div>
                    <span class="icon icon-close-rounded"></span>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                    <td class="text-center"><span class="icon icon-fault-major"></span></td>
                    <td class="n-drillDown-item" data-target-selector="#item4"><span>Major fault</span>/td>
                    <td class="n-cell-error text-right n-drillDown-item" data-target-selector="#item5"><span>2010</span></td>

                    </div>

    <!-- Java Script -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

Pull down with scrollbar

  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List item 3

  • List very long long long long item 6

  • List item 2
  • List item 3
  • List item 4
  • List item 5
  • List very long long long long item 6
  • Zero
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List item 3
  • List item 4
  • List item 5
  • List very long long long long item 6
  • Zero
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

JS & CSS dependency:

For pull down with scrollbar components,you can use following css import code:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tooltip.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

    <!-- Basic Pull down -->
    <div class="btn-group selectlist selectlist-resize" data-resize="auto" data-initialize="selectlist" id="mySelectlist">
    <button class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" type="button">
    <span class="selected-label"></span>
    <span class="selected-caret" ><span class="caret"></span></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
    </button>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu n-dropdown-menu-scroll" role="menu">
    <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
    <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
    </ul>
    <input class="hidden hidden-field" name="mySelectlist" readonly="readonly" aria-hidden="true" type="text"/>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <script>
        $('#mySelectlist').adaptiveSelectlist();
        $(document).ready(function(){
            $(".n-dropdown-menu-scroll").nScrollbar();
        })
    </script>

    <!-- The default value of pull down menu height is 150px. You can change the height by definition of follow style -->
    .n-dropdown-menu-scroll{
        height: 200px !important;
    }

Pull down

  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List very long long long long item 3
  • List very long long long long item 312
  • List very long long long long item 31244
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List very long long long long item 3
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List very long long long long item 3
  • List very long long long long item 312
  • List very long long long long item 31244
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List very long long long long item 3
  • List very long long long long item 312
  • List very long long long long item 31244
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List very long long long long item 3
  • Menu
  • List item 1
  • List item 2

JS & CSS dependency:

for Pull down components,you can use following css import code:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tooltip.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

For getting the disabled version, add disabled as a class into the top div. For getting the dark version, add selectlist-dark as a class into the top div. For getting the small version, add selectlist-small as a class into the top div. For more information about this component, see FuelUX documentation about Selectlist.


    <!-- Basic Pull down -->
    <div class="btn-group selectlist selectlist-resize" data-resize="none" data-initialize="selectlist" id="mySelectlist">
    <button class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" type="button">
    <span class="selected-label"></span>
    <span class="selected-caret" ><span class="caret"></span></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
    </button>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu">
    <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
    <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
    </ul>
    <input class="hidden hidden-field" name="mySelectlist" readonly="readonly" aria-hidden="true" type="text"/>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script">
        require(['jquery', 'wulf_umd'], function($){ });
    </script>

Using pull down component in scroll table need additional statement.


    <td class="text-center">
    <div class="btn-group selectlist selectlist-resize" data-resize="none" data-initialize="selectlist" id="mySelectlist" data-position="fixed">
    <button class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" type="button">
    <span class="selected-label"></span>
    <span class="selected-caret" ><span class="caret"></span></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
    </button>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu">
    <li data-value="1"><a href="#"><span>One</span></a></li>
    <li data-value="2"><a href="#"><span>Two</span></a></li>
    </ul>
    <input class="hidden hidden-field" name="mySelectlist" readonly="readonly" aria-hidden="true" type="text"/>
    </div>

About dialog

About dialog can be used to display common information about the Web pages.

About dialog

About WULF

FB15.03.0007

System Information
LTE BTS Site Manager: 5.0.1
Multimedia Manager: 8.0.1.283
NetAct™ Realtime Performance Monitoring: 6.0.0.188
© 2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.

JS & CSS dependency:

For about dialog components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dialog.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

    <!-- Standard about dialog -->
    <a href="#AboutDialog" data-backdrop="false" data-toggle="modal">About dialog</a>
Modify the size of the title banner area (curve location) in CSS: 

    .n-dialog-about > div.modal-content > div.modal-header {
        .n-dialog-header-curve {
            left: 140px;
        }
        .n-dialog-header-fg-filler {
            width: 140px;
        }
    }

Nokia Banner(filter bar)

Nokia Banner(filter bar) is based on the Nokia Banner component and it has a filter bar to confirm some information, such as time and location.

WebUI Look & Feel (WULF)
  • User Name

  • |

  • Account
    • Account subitem

  • |

  • Log Out
    HIGH VALUE CUSTOMER INSIGHTS
  • Dec 2013, Algeria, All cities
          • Specific time (mm/yyyy)
          • List
          • List


          JS & CSS dependency:

          For action navigation control components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.search.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.list.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.navigation.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

          Click <li> infilter-bar-nav to open or close filter bar.
          The filter-bar-setting-item item changes when select all lists and then hover on it.
          Add filter list in filter-bar-content and add filter title in filter-bar-footer.

          Use loadCountries function in navfilterbar.js to load countries and cities: 

                  
    <script>
        require(['jquery', 'wulf_umd'], function ($) {
            $(function(){
                $.getJSON("../wulfdist/js/countries-cities.json", function (countriesCities) {
                    $("#nokia_banner").loadCountries(countriesCities);
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
        
    
                  
    <nav class="n-banner">
        <div class="n-banner-1st-filler-white"></div>
        <div class="n-banner-1st-filler-blue"></div>
        <div class="n-banner-2nd-filler-blue hidden-xs"></div>
        <div class="n-banner-2nd-filler-gray hidden-xs"></div>
        <div class="container">
            <div class="n-banner-header"></div>
            <div class="collapse n-banner-collapse" id="n-banner-collapse">
                <div class="row n-banner-1st"></div>
                <div class="row n-banner-2nd"></div>

<!-- filter bar start -->
                <div class="row n-banner-3rd filter-bar">
                    <div class="filter-bar-content">
                        <div class="n-banner-right">
                            <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-group-dark filter-bar-list n-list-months"></ul>
                            <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-group-dark filter-bar-list n-list-years"></ul>
                            <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-group-dark n-list-countries"></ul>
                            <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-group-dark n-list-cities"></ul>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="filter-bar-footer">
                        <div class="n-banner-right">
                            <ul class="n-banner-nav n-banner-links">
                                <li>
                                    <div>
                                        <span>Specific Time <span>(mm/yyyy)</span></span>
                                        <span class="filter-caret"></span>
                                    </div>
                                </li>
                                <li>
                                    <div>
                                        <span>List</span>
                                        <span class="filter-caret"></span>
                                    </div>
                                </li>
                                <li>
                                    <div>
                                        <span>List</span>
                                        <span class="filter-caret"></span>
                                    </div>
                                </li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
<!-- filter bar end -->

            </div>
        </div>
    </nav>
