          Action Navigation Controls - SelfCare

          WebUI Look & Feel (WULF)
          • User Name

          • |

          • Log Out
          • Item 1
          • Item 2
            • Subitem one
            • Subitem two
            • Subitem three
              • Option one
                • One: item one
                • One: item two
              • Option two
              • Option three
                • Three: item one
                • Three: item two
          • Item 3
          • Item 4
          • Item 5
          • Item 6
          • +49 (460) 860-8012
          • Anchor1 One
          • Anchor1 Two
          • Anchor1 Three
          • Anchor1 Four
          • Anchor3 One
          • Anchor3 Two
          • Anchor3 Three
          • Anchor3 Four


          JS & CSS dependency:

          For action navigation control components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.search.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.navigation.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

          You can make use of the action navigation controls by creating a div container with class n-banner-right. Inside the div, create a list with class n-banner-nav n-banner-links. Then, put an icon tag with class icon icon-phone along with the span. 

                      
                <div class="n-banner-right">
                <ul class="n-banner-nav n-banner-links">
                <li>
                <a href="#">
                <span>
                    <i class="icon icon-phone"></i>
                    <span>+49 (460) 860-8012</span>
                </span>
                </a>
                </li>
                </ul>
                </div>

          Source code for the navigation control used on this page that supports the collapse feature: 

                      
                <div class="n-banner-right n-banner-links-collapse
                dropdown">
                <a href="#" class="n-banner-dropdown-toggle n-banner-links-collapse-dropdown-toggle
                show-on-blue-detached" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false" role="button">
                <span class="icon icon-dropdown-menu"></span>
                </a>
                <ul class="n-banner-nav n-banner-links">
                <li>
                <a href="#">
                <span>
                    <i class="icon icon-phone"></i>
                    <span>+49 (460) 860-8012</span>
                </span>
                </a>
                </li>
                </ul>
                </div>

          Banner

          Nokia Banner is based on the Bootstrap Navbar component. Click the tree folder and show the corresponding page.

          Calendar with time

          Calendar with data-markup API for 24 Hours time

          Disbaled calendar with data-markup API for 24 Hours time

          Calendar without data-markup API for 12 Hours time

          SUN MON TUE WED THU FRI SAT

          Month

          Year

            Disabled calendar without data-markup API for 12 Hours time

            SUN MON TUE WED THU FRI SAT

            Month

            Year

              <!-- CSS dependency: -->
<link href="./wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.calendar.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.spinner.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

<div id="calendar_datetime_12hour" class="datepicker fuelux">
    <div class="input-group n-calendar">
        <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDatepickerInput1" name="myDatepickerName" data-markup="timer_calendar" type="text"/>
    </div>
</div>

<!-- Java Script -->
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/moment-with-locales.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

<script>
$(document).ready(function () {
    $('#calendar_datetime_12hour').datepicker({
        allowPastDates: true,
        momentConfig: {
            culture: 'en',
            format: 'DD.MM.YYYY hh:mm A' //Please check the end of this page for more datetime format
        }
    });
    $('#calendar_datetime_12hour').datepicker('initTimer'); //call this method if you want to show time setting.
});
</script>

              If you provide data-markup attribute as the example, the HTML markups of calendar will be generated automatically next to the input element which provides the data-markup attribute. Otherwise you should specify your HTML markup by yourself. We have prepared HTML markups for you as following. Please be noted that if you use the data-markup to generate the HTML markups automatically, you should not use 'data-initialize' to initialize the calendar at the same time. 

              <div class="input-group-btn">
    <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown">
        <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-calendar"></span>
        <span class="sr-only">Toggle Calendar</span>
    </button>
    <div class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right datepicker-calendar-wrapper" role="menu">
        <div class="datepicker-calendar">
            <div class="datepicker-calendar-header">
                <button type="button" class="prev"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Previous Month</span></button>
                <button type="button" class="next"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-right"></span><span class="sr-only">Next Month</span></button>
                <button type="button" class="title">
                    <span class="month">
                    <span data-month="0">January</span>
                    <span data-month="1">February</span>
                    <span data-month="2">March</span>
                    <span data-month="3">April</span>
                    <span data-month="4">May</span>
                    <span data-month="5">June</span>
                    <span data-month="6">July</span>
                    <span data-month="7">August</span>
                    <span data-month="8">September</span>
                    <span data-month="9">October</span>
                    <span data-month="10">November</span>
                    <span data-month="11">December</span>
                    </span> <span class="year"></span>
                </button>
            </div>
            <table class="datepicker-calendar-days">
                <thead>
                    <tr>
                        <th>Su</th>
                        <th>Mo</th>
                        <th>Tu</th>
                        <th>We</th>
                        <th>Th</th>
                        <th>Fr</th>
                        <th>Sa</th>
                    </tr>
                </thead>
                <tbody></tbody>
            </table>
            <div class="datepicker-calendar-timer">
                <div class="spinner-container datepicker-calendar-hour">
                    <div class="spinbox" data-initialize="spinbox">
                        <input type="text" class="form-control spinbox-input n-inputfield">
                        <div class="spinbox-buttons btn-group btn-group-vertical">
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-up btn-xs">
                                <span class="icon icon-arrow-up"></span>
                                <span class="sr-only">Increase</span>
                            </button>
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-down btn-xs">
                                <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                                <span class="sr-only">Decrease</span>
                            </button>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                <div class="spinner-container datepicker-calendar-minute">
                    <div class="spinbox" data-initialize="spinbox">
                        <input type="text" class="form-control spinbox-input n-inputfield">
                        <div class="spinbox-buttons btn-group btn-group-vertical">
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-up btn-xs">
                                <span class="icon icon-arrow-up"></span>
                                <span class="sr-only">Increase</span>
                            </button>
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-down btn-xs">
                                <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                                <span class="sr-only">Decrease</span>
                            </button>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

                <div class="spinner-container datepicker-calendar-AMPM">
                    <div class="spinbox" data-initialize="spinbox">
                        <input type="text" tabIndex="-1" class="form-control spinbox-input n-inputfield n-inputfield-uneditable" readonly>
                        <div class="spinbox-buttons btn-group btn-group-vertical">
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-up btn-xs">
                                <span class="icon icon-arrow-up"></span>
                                <span class="sr-only">Increase</span>
                            </button>
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-down btn-xs">
                                <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                                <span class="sr-only">Decrease</span>
                            </button>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <input type="text" tabIndex="-1" class="form-control spinbox-input n-inputfield ampm n-inputfield-uneditable" readonly>
                </div>
                <div class="operator-btn">
                    <button type="button" class="btn btn-small now">Now</button> <button type="button" class="btn btn-defaultBlue btn-small done">Done</button>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="datepicker-wheels" aria-hidden="true">
            <div class="datepicker-wheels-month">
                <h2 class="header">Month</h2>
                <ul>
                    <li data-month="0"><button type="button">Jan</button></li>
                    <li data-month="1"><button type="button">Feb</button></li>
                    <li data-month="2"><button type="button">Mar</button></li>
                    <li data-month="3"><button type="button">Apr</button></li>
                    <li data-month="4"><button type="button">May</button></li>
                    <li data-month="5"><button type="button">Jun</button></li>
                    <li data-month="6"><button type="button">Jul</button></li>
                    <li data-month="7"><button type="button">Aug</button></li>
                    <li data-month="8"><button type="button">Sep</button></li>
                    <li data-month="9"><button type="button">Oct</button></li>
                    <li data-month="10"><button type="button">Nov</button></li>
                    <li data-month="11"><button type="button">Dec</button></li>
                </ul>
            </div>
            <div class="datepicker-wheels-year">
                <h2 class="header">Year</h2>
                <ul></ul>
            </div>
            <div class="datepicker-wheels-footer clearfix">
                <button type="button" class="btn datepicker-wheels-back"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-arrow-left"></span><span class="sr-only">Return to Calendar</span></button>
                <button type="button" class="btn datepicker-wheels-select">Select <span class="sr-only">Month and Year</span></button>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

              If you put your HTML markups by yourself, you can do the same thing as the first demo to initialize datepicker by passing your options as following. 

              <div id="calendar_datetime_24hour" class="datepicker fuelux">
    <div class="input-group n-calendar">
        <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDatepickerInput1" name="myDatepickerName" type="text"/>
        *Copy the HTML markups to here*
    </div>
</div>

<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#calendar_datetime_24hour').datepicker({
            allowPastDates: true,
            momentConfig: {
                culture: 'en',
                format: 'DD.MM.YYYY HH:mm:ss'
            }
        });
         $('#calendar_datetime_24hour').datepicker('initTimer');
    });
</script>

              To disable the calender, you can simply add disabled attribute to the element and if you are using the markup-API, please also update the data-markup. 

                      
    <div id="disabled_calendar_datetime_12hour" class="col-md-9 datepicker fuelux">
        <div class="input-group n-calendar">
            <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDisabledDatepickerInput1" name="myDatepickerName"
                   data-markup="disabled_timer_calendar" type="text" disabled>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="input-group n-calendar">
        <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDisabledDatepickerInput2" name="myDatepickerName"
               data-markup="timer_calendar" type="text" disabled>

        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"
                    aria-expanded="false" disabled>
                <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-calendar"></span>
                <span class="sr-only">Toggle Calendar</span>
            </button>
            ... ...
        </div>
    </div>

              Using calendar component in scroll table need additional statement. 

                      
    <td class="text-center">
        <div id="calendar_date3" class="datepicker fuelux">
            <div class="input-group n-calendar">
                <input id="calendar-id" name="calendar-name" type="text"
                       class="form-control n-inputfield" data-markup="timer_calendar" data-position="fixed"/>
            </div>
        </div>
    </td>

              Date time format:

              
        
        
              
            InputExampleDescription
        
              
                      
        
        
              D/DD1..31Day of month
              
        
              M/MM1..12Month number
              
        
              YY/YYYY20144 or 2 digit year
              
        
              H/HH0..2324 hour time
              
        
              h/hh1..1212 hour time used with a A.
              
        
              m/mm0..59Minutes
              
        
              s/ss0..59Seconds
              
        
              a/Aam pmPost or ante meridiem (Note the one character a p are also considered valid)
              
                  

              
Examples:
1.DD.MM.YYYY HH:mm                14.04.2016 14:05
2.DD.MM.YYYY hh:mm A              14.04.2016 02:05 PM

              Calendar

              Calendar with data-markup API

              Disbaled calendar with data-markup API

              Calendar without data-markup API

              SUN MON TUE WED THU FRI SAT

              Month

              Year

                Disabled calendar without data-markup API

                SUN MON TUE WED THU FRI SAT

                Month

                Year

                  Calendar with past days locked

                  Calendar with date range

                          
    <!-- CSS dependency: -->
    <link href="./wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.calendar.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

    <div id="calendar_date" class="datepicker fuelux">
        <div class="input-group n-calendar">
            <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDatepickerInput1" name="myDatepickerName" data-markup="calendar" type="text"/>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Java Script -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/moment-with-locales.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

    <script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#calendar_date').datepicker({
        allowPastDates: true,
        momentConfig: {
        culture: 'en',
        format: 'DD.MM.YYYY'
        }
        });
    });
    </script>

                  If you provide data-markup attribute as the example, the HTML markups of calendar will be generated automatically next to the input element which provides the data-markup attribute. Otherwise you should specify your HTML markup by yourself. We have prepared HTML markups for you as following. Please be noted that if you use the data-markup to generate the HTML markups automatically, you should not use 'data-initialize' to initialize the calendar at the same time. 

                      
    <div class="input-group-btn">
        <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown">
            <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-calendar"></span>
            <span class="sr-only">Toggle Calendar</span>
        </button>
        <div class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right datepicker-calendar-wrapper" role="menu">
            <div class="datepicker-calendar">
                <div class="datepicker-calendar-header">
                    <button type="button" class="prev"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-left"></span><span
                    class="sr-only">Previous Month</span></button>
                    <button type="button" class="next"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-right"></span><span
                    class="sr-only">Next Month</span></button>
                    <button type="button" class="title">
                    <span class="month">
                    <span data-month="0">January</span>
                    <span data-month="1">February</span>
                    <span data-month="2">March</span>
                    <span data-month="3">April</span>
                    <span data-month="4">May</span>
                    <span data-month="5">June</span>
                    <span data-month="6">July</span>
                    <span data-month="7">August</span>
                    <span data-month="8">September</span>
                    <span data-month="9">October</span>
                    <span data-month="10">November</span>
                    <span data-month="11">December</span>
                    </span> <span class="year"></span>
                    </button>
                    </div>
                    <table class="datepicker-calendar-days">
                    <thead>
                    <tr>
                    <th>Su</th>
                    <th>Mo</th>
                    <th>Tu</th>
                    <th>We</th>
                    <th>Th</th>
                    <th>Fr</th>
                    <th>Sa</th>
                    </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody></tbody>
                    </table>
                    </div>
                    <div class="datepicker-wheels" aria-hidden="true">
                    <div class="datepicker-wheels-month">
                    <h2 class="header">Month</h2>
                    <ul>
                    <li data-month="0"><button type="button">Jan</button></li>
                    <li data-month="1"><button type="button">Feb</button></li>
                    <li data-month="2"><button type="button">Mar</button></li>
                    <li data-month="3"><button type="button">Apr</button></li>
                    <li data-month="4"><button type="button">May</button></li>
                    <li data-month="5"><button type="button">Jun</button></li>
                    <li data-month="6"><button type="button">Jul</button></li>
                    <li data-month="7"><button type="button">Aug</button></li>
                    <li data-month="8"><button type="button">Sep</button></li>
                    <li data-month="9"><button type="button">Oct</button></li>
                    <li data-month="10"><button type="button">Nov</button></li>
                    <li data-month="11"><button type="button">Dec</button></li>
                    </ul>
                    </div>
                    <div class="datepicker-wheels-year">
                    <h2 class="header">Year</h2>
                    <ul></ul>
                    </div>
                    <div class="datepicker-wheels-footer clearfix">
                    <button type="button" class="btn datepicker-wheels-back"><span class="glyphicon glyphicon-arrow-left"></span><span
                    class="sr-only">Return to Calendar</span></button>
                    <button type="button" class="btn datepicker-wheels-select">Select <span class="sr-only">Month and
                    Year</span></button>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

                  If you put your HTML markups by yourself, you can do the same thing as the first demo to initialize datepicker by passing your options as following. 

                          
    <div id="calendar_date" class="datepicker fuelux">
        <div class="input-group n-calendar">
            <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDatepickerInput1" name="myDatepickerName" type="text"/>
            *Copy the HTML markups to here*
        </div>
    </div>

    <script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#calendar_datetime').datepicker({
        allowPastDates: true,
        momentConfig: {
        culture: 'en',
        format: 'DD.MM.YYYY HH:mm:ss'
        }
        });
    });
    </script>

                  To disable the calender, you can simply add disabled attribute to the element and if you are using the markup-API, please also update the data-markup. 

                          
    <div id="disabled_calendar_date" class="col-md-9 datepicker fuelux">
        <div class="input-group n-calendar">
            <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDisabledDatepickerInput1" name="myDatepickerName"
                   data-markup="disabled_calendar" type="text" disabled>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="input-group n-calendar">
        <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDisabledDatepickerInput2" name="myDatepickerName"
               data-markup="calendar" type="text" disabled>

        <div class="input-group-btn">
            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"
                    aria-expanded="false" disabled>
                <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-calendar"></span>
                <span class="sr-only">Toggle Calendar</span>
            </button>
            ... ...
        </div>
    </div>

                  Using calendar component in scroll table need additional statement. 

                          
    <td class="text-center">
        <div id="calendar_date3" class="datepicker fuelux">
            <div class="input-group n-calendar">
                <input id="calendar-id" name="calendar-name" type="text"
                       class="form-control n-inputfield" data-markup="calendar" data-position="fixed"/>
            </div>
        </div>
    </td>

                  To disable the past days in calendar, you can add class 'n-calendar-lock-past' to the calendar element. 

                          
    <div class="input-group n-calendar n-calendar-lock-past">
        <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="myDatepickerInputLocked" name="myDatepickerName"
               data-markup="calendar" type="text">
    </div>

                  Using calendar with date range, you need two calendar components using class 'n-data-range-start'and class 'n-data-range-end', respectively. 

                          
    <div id="calendar_date_range" class="n-data-range">
        <div class="datepicker fuelux">
            <div class="input-group n-calendar n-data-range-start">
                <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="dateRangeInput1" name="dataRangeName1"
                       data-markup="calendar" type="text">
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="datepicker fuelux">
            <div class="input-group n-calendar n-data-range-end">
                <input class="form-control n-inputfield" id="dateRangeInput2" name="dataRangeName2"
                       data-markup="calendar" type="text">
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#calendar_date_range').nDateRangePicker({
            allowPastDates: true,
            momentConfig: {
                culture: 'en',
                format: 'DD.MM.YYYY'
            }
        });
    });
    </script>

                  Bar Chart (jqWidget)


                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For bar chart(jqWidget) components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link  href="../wulfdist/css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.chart.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  Place the chart into a <div> 

                  
<!-- Main chart div -->
<div id="chartContainer" style="width:600px; height:400px">
</div>

                  Data and Settings ( For more settings, see the jqxChart API Reference )

                  
// the data to show on the chart
var sampleData = [
    {Voice: '0m', Data: "14"},
    {Voice: '25m', Data: "15"},
    {Voice: '50m', Data: "18"},
    {Voice: '100m', Data: "5.4"},
    {Voice: '125m', Data: "2.7"},
    {Voice: '150m', Data: "4"},
    {Voice: '200m', Data: "2"},
    {Voice: '250m', Data: "6"},
    {Voice: '275m', Data: "9"},
    {Voice: '300m', Data: "5"},
    {Voice: '350m', Data: "12.7"},
    {Voice: '375m', Data: "8"},
    {Voice: '400m', Data: "17"},
    {Voice: '425m', Data: "15"},
    {Voice: '450m', Data: "12"},
    {Voice: '500m', Data: "6"}
];
var settings = {
    title: "",
    borderLineWidth: 1,
    enableAnimations: true,
    backgroundColor:"transparent",
    showBorderLine: false,
    description: '',
    showLegend: false,
    showToolTips: false,
    source: sampleData,
    xAxis: {
        dataField: 'Voice',
        unitInterval: 3,
        verticalTextAlignment:'bottom',
        formatFunction: function (value) {
        return value;
        },
        labels: {
            angle: 0,
            offset: {x: 0, y: 24}
        },
        gridLines: {
            visible: false,
            color: '#FFFFFF'
        },
        title:{
            text: 'Voice usage',
            offset: { x: 0, y: 27 }
        },
        tickMarks: {
            visible: false,
        },
        // make the vertical line dispaly none
        valuesOnTicks: false
    },
    colorScheme: 'scheme05',
    seriesGroups: [{
        type: 'column',
        valueAxis: {
        position: 'right',
        title: {
            text: 'Data usage',
            offset: { x: 25, y: 0 }
        },
        formatFunction: function (value) {
            return value + '%';
        },
        labels: {
            horizontalAlignment: 'left',
            offset: {x: 25, y: 0}
        },
        line: {visible: false},
        maxValue: 18,
        minValue: 0,
        unitInterval: 2
        },
        series: [{
            legendFillColor:"transparent",
            legendLineColor:"transparent",
            dataField: 'Data',
            displayText: 'Voice usage',
            toolTipFormatFunction: function (value, itemIndex, serie, group, categoryValue) {
                return '<div class="tooltip-inner" style="text-align:left;z-index: 2";><b>Year-Voice: </b>' + categoryValue
                + '<br /><b>GDP Data:</b> ' + value + ' %</div>'
                }
            }
        ]}
    ]
};
// prepare chart data
// select the chartContainer DIV element and render the chart.
$('#chartContainer').jqxChart(settings);

                  Horizontal Bar Chart (jqWidget)


                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For bar chart(jqWidget) components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link  href="../wulfdist/css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.chart.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  Place the chart into a <div> 

                  
<!-- Main chart div -->
<div id="chartContainer" style="width:800px; height:300px">
</div>

                  Data and Settings ( For more settings, see the jqxChart API Reference )

                  
// the data to show on the chart
var sampleData = [
    { Phone: 'iPhone 3', Percentage: 6.4 },
    { Phone: 'Nokia N9', Percentage: 4.2 },
    { Phone: 'Blackberry', Percentage: 4.6 },
    { Phone: 'iPhone 4', Percentage: 3.5 },
    { Phone: 'HTC Desire', Percentage: 2.9 }];
// prepare jqxChart settings
var settings = {
    title: "",
    description: "",
    borderLineWidth: 1,
    backgroundColor:"transparent",
    showBorderLine: false,
    showLegend: true,
    legendLayout: {
        left: 600,
        top: 123,
        width: 300,
        height: 200,
        flow: 'vertical'
    },
    enableAnimations: true,
    padding: { left: 82, top: 200, right: 240, bottom: 36 },
    source: sampleData,
    xAxis:
    {
        dataField: 'Phone',
        flip: false,
        labels: { 
            visible: true, 
            angle: 90,
            offset: {x: -82, y: 0},
            horizontalAlignment: "left",
        },
        gridLines: {
            visible: false,
            color: '#FFFFFF'
        },
        tickMarks: {
            visible: false,
        },
    },
    valueAxis:
    {
        flip: true,
        labels: {
            visible: true,
            formatFunction: function (value) {
                return value
            },
            offset:{x:0, y:4}
        },
        gridLines: {
            visible: true,
            step:1,
            color: '#B1B1B1',
            lineWidth: 10,
        },
        line:{visible: false},
        minValue: 0,
        maxValue: 7,
        unitInterval: 1,
        padding:{left:58,  right:0 },
        tickMarks :{
            size: 20,
        },
    },
    colorScheme: 'scheme01',
    seriesGroups:[
       {
           type: 'column',
           orientation: 'horizontal',
           columnsGapPercent: 13,
           toolTipFormatSettings: { thousandsSeparator: ',' },
           toolTipFormatFunction: function(value){
               return "Data "+ value +"%"
           },
           series: [
               { dataField: 'Percentage',
                   displayText: 'Voice' ,
                   formatSettings: { sufix: '%'},
                   labels: {
                        visible: true,
                        formatSettings: { sufix: '%'},
                        offset: { x: -30, y: 2 }
                    },
               },
           ]
       }
    ]
};
// setup the chart
$('#chartContainer').jqxChart(settings);

                  Line Chart (jQWidget)


                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For line chart(jQWidget) components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.chart.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  Place the chart into a <div> 

                  
<!-- Main chart div -->
<div id="chartContainer" style="width:600px; height:450px">
</div>

                  Data and Settings ( For more settings, see the jqxChart API Reference )

                  
// the data to show on the chart
var sampleData = [
    { 'CE index': '10', iPhone3: 120, 'Nokia N9': 105},
    { 'CE index': '20', iPhone3: 115, 'Nokia N9': 106},
    { 'CE index': '30', iPhone3: 118, 'Nokia N9': 115},
    { 'CE index': '40', iPhone3: 112, 'Nokia N9': 107},
    { 'CE index': '50', iPhone3: 128, 'Nokia N9': 103},
    { 'CE index': '60', iPhone3: 110, 'Nokia N9': 110},
    { 'CE index': '70', iPhone3: 111, 'Nokia N9': 106},
    { 'CE index': '80', iPhone3: 109, 'Nokia N9': 100},
    { 'CE index': '90', iPhone3: 123, 'Nokia N9': 118},
    { 'CE index': '100', iPhone3: 110, 'Nokia N9': 106}
];
// prepare jqxChart settings
var settings = {
    title: '',
    description: '',
    enableAnimations: true,
    showLegend: true,
    legendLayout: {
        left: 460,
        top: 0,
        width: 300,
        height: 200,
        flow: 'vertical'
    },
    showBorderLine: false,
    backgroundColor:'transparent',
    source: sampleData,
    xAxis: {
        dataField: 'CE index',
        unitInterval: 10,
        verticalTextAlignment:'bottom',
        tickMarks: { visible: true, interval: 1 },
        line: {
            visible: false,
        },
        valuesOnTicks: false,
        labels: {
            offset: { x: 0, y: 24 }
        },
        title:{
            text: 'CE index',
            offset: { x: 0, y: 27 }
        },
        gridLines: {
            visible: false,
            color: '#FFFFFF'
        },
        tickMarks: {
            visible: false,
        },
    },
    valueAxis: {
        position: 'right',
        unitInterval: 20,
        minValue: 0,
        maxValue: 140,
        title: {
            text: 'Number of subscribers',
            offset: { x: 25, y: 0 }
        },
        labels: {
            horizontalAlignment: 'left',
            offset: { x: 25, y: 0 }
        }
    },
    seriesGroups: [
        {
            toolTipFormatFunction: function (value, itemIndex) {
                var dataItem = sampleData[itemIndex];
                var ceIndex  = dataItem['CE index'];
                return 'CE index ' + ceIndex + ' <b>' + value + '</b>';
            },
            type: 'line',
            series: [
                {
                    dataField: 'iPhone3',
                    symbolType: 'circle',
                    lineColor:'#0B6DAF',
                    lineColorSymbol :'#0B6DAF',
                    fillColorSymbol :'#0B6DAF',
                    legendFillColor :'#0B6DAF',
                    legendLineColor  : '#0B6DAF'
                },
                {
                    dataField: 'Nokia N9',
                    symbolType: 'circle',
                    lineColor:'#B3B8BC',
                    lineColorSymbol:'#B3B8BC',
                    fillColorSymbol:'#B3B8BC',
                    legendFillColor:'#B3B8BC',
                    legendLineColor :'#B3B8BC'
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
};
// select the chartContainer DIV element and render the chart.
$('#chartContainer').jqxChart(settings);

                  Pie Chart (jQWidget)

                  Large version

                  Small version

                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For bar chart(jqWidget) components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link  href="../wulfdist/css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.chart.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  Place the chart into a <div> 

                  
<!-- Main chart div -->
<div id="chartContainer" style="width:600px; height:600px">
</div>

                  Data and Settings ( For more settings, see the jqxChart API Reference )

                  
// the data to show on the chart
var sampleData = [
    {'Phone':'Model J','Share':15},
    {'Phone':'Model I','Share':4},
    {'Phone':'Model H','Share':4},
    {'Phone':'Model G','Share':15},
    {'Phone':'Model F','Share':16},
    {'Phone':'Model E','Share':7},
    {'Phone':'Model D','Share':28},
    {'Phone':'Model C','Share':3},
    {'Phone':'Model B','Share':4},
    {'Phone':'Model A','Share':5}
];
// the settings of the chart
var settings = {
    title: '',
    description: '',
    enableAnimations: true,
    showLegend: false,
    showBorderLine: false,
    backgroundColor:'transparent',
    source: sampleData,
    seriesGroups:
        [
            {
                type: 'donut',
                showLabels: true,
                toolTipFormatFunction: function (value, itemIndex) {
                    var browser =  sampleData[itemIndex]['Phone'];
                    return browser + '  <b>' + value + '</b>';
                },
                series:
                    [
                        {
                            dataField: 'Share',
                            displayText: 'Phone',
                            labelRadius: 175,
                            initialAngle: 90,
                            radius: 165,
                            innerRadius: 100,
                            centerOffset: 0,
                            formatFunction : function (value, itemIndex) {
                                var browser =  sampleData[itemIndex]['Phone'];
                                return browser + ' ' + value + '%';
                            }
                        }
                    ]
            }
        ]
};
// setup the chart
$('#chartContainer').jqxChart(settings);
$('#chartContainer').jqxChart('addColorScheme', 'nokiaScheme', ['#00F04D','#DB6D00','#D8D9DA','#68717A','#FFCC00','#474747','#00C9FF','#124191','#B3B8BC','#0B6DAF']);
$('#chartContainer').jqxChart('colorScheme', 'nokiaScheme');

                  Speedometer (jqWidget) (DRAFT)


                  Place the speedometer into a <div> 

                  
    <!-- Main speedometer div -->
    <div id="gaugeContainer" style="width:600px; height:400px">
    </div>

                  Data and Settings ( For more settings, see the jqxGauge API Reference )

                  
    $('#gaugeContainer').jqxGauge({
        ranges: [
            { startValue: 0, endValue: 55, style: { fill: '#C9C9C9', stroke: '#C9C9C9' }, endWidth: 5, startWidth: 1 },
            { startValue: 55, endValue: 110, style: { fill: '#FCF06A', stroke: '#FCF06A' }, endWidth: 10, startWidth: 5 },
            { startValue: 110, endValue: 165, style: { fill: '#FCA76A', stroke: '#FCA76A' }, endWidth: 15, startWidth: 10 },
            { startValue: 165, endValue: 220, style: { fill: '#FC6A6A', stroke: '#FC6A6A' }, endWidth: 20, startWidth: 15}],
        ticksMinor: { interval: 5, size: '5%' },
        ticksMajor: { interval: 10, size: '9%' },
        value: 0,
        colorScheme: 'scheme03',
        animationDuration: 1200
        });
    $('#gaugeContainer').jqxGauge('value', 140);

                  Charts

                  There are 2 major charts libraries used in the company: jqxChart(from jqWidget library) and HighCharts. Currently the HighCharts requires license purchase from you before it can be used. Therefore we recommend to use jqxChart where we have company license in place.


                  jqxChart

                  Bar chart
                  Horizontal bar chart
                  Line chart
                  Speedometer (DRAFT)
                  Pie chart


                  Licensing

                  We have a company wide commercial license in place, you don't need to purchase separate licenses.
                  Licensing owner for jqWidgets: Jani Latvala


                  HighCharts

                  We have tuned one chart of Highcharts to match OT3 specification as an example. Note that the following pages do not display correctly as Highcharts is not distributed within WULF. If you have licensed HighCharts, you can get the example pages below to display correctly by placing the HighCharts files into wulffulldist/js folder.

                  Stacked bar
                  Bar
                  Example without OT3


                  Nokia Internal Usage Licensing = you create application which is used only by Nokia personnel:
                  • Raise a myOrder request stating in the comment what you wish to purchase (purchasing link with the exact product)
                  • The category should be: IT procurement - Application development - Software
                  • Do not select vendor
                  • Select price request on item and order level
                  • Add to the item description also the product you wish to go for
                  This will be handled then by Tactical sourcing.

                  Nokia External Usage Licensing = you create application which is used by Nokia customers / partners:

                  • Contact Marek Schmidt for further instructions

                  Overall procurement owner for HighCharts: Frida Janak-Zsurko

                  Active dialog

                  Here are example of the active dialog:

                  Dialog (active)

                  Active dialog

                  Text

                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For active dialog components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dialog.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  To use the dialogs, see the examples below. 

                  
<!-- Standard dialog -->
<a href="#ActiveDialog" data-backdrop="false" data-toggle="modal">Active dialog</a>

                  You can make use of the active dialog by add class active.See the examples below. 

                  
<!-- Standard dialog -->
<div class="modal active" id="ActiveDialog" role="dialog" aria-labelledby="myModalDlgLabel-active" aria-hidden="true" tabindex='-1'>
<div class="modal-dialog">
            <div class="modal-content">
                <div class="modal-header">
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-fg-filler"><div>
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-bg-filler"></div>
                    
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-curve">
                        <div class="fg-mask"></div>
                        <div class="bg-mask"></div>
                        <div class="fg-corner"></div>
                        <div class="bg-corner"></div>
                    </div>
                    <i role="button" class="icon icon-close-rounded" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close dialog"></i>
                    <h1 class="modal-title-active">Active Dialog</h1>
                </div>
                <div class="modal-body">
                    Text
                </div>
                <div class="modal-footer">
                    <button class="btn btn-standard" data-dismiss="modal">OK</button>
                    <button class="btn btn-standard" data-dismiss="modal">Cancel</button>
               </div>
            </div>
        </div>
</div>

                  Dialog

                  Click the tree folder to see the corresponding page. 
                  
    <!-- Dialog generic principle -->
    <a href="#PlainDialogSubhead" data-backdrop="false" data-toggle="modal" data-keyboard="true">Dialog</a>
    <div class="modal" id="PlainDialogSubhead" role="dialog" aria-labelledby="myModalDlgLabel-subhead" aria-hidden="true" tabindex='-1'>
        <div class="modal-dialog">
            <div class="modal-content">
                <div class="modal-header">
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-fg-filler"></div>
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-bg-filler"></div>
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-curve">
                        <div class="fg-mask"></div>
                        <div class="bg-mask"></div>
                        <div class="fg-corner"></div>
                        <div class="bg-corner"></div>
                    </div>
                    <i class="icon icon-close-rounded" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close"></i>
                    <h1 class="modal-title" id="myModalLabel">Plain Dialog</h1>
                    <h2 class="modal-title-subheading" id="myModalLabelVersion">Subheading</h2>
                </div>
                <div class="modal-body"> Text </div>
                <div class="modal-footer">
                    <button class="btn btn-standard btn-defaultBlue" data-dismiss="modal">OK</button>
                    <button class="btn btn-standard" data-dismiss="modal">Cancel</button>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
                  Modify the size of the title banner area (curve location) in CSS: 
                  
    .n-dialog-header-curve {
        left: 140px;
    }
    .n-dialog-header-fg-filler {
        width: 140px;
    }

                  Resize and drag dialog DRAFT

                  Here are example of the plain dialog support resize and drag:

                  Dialog (plain, subheader)

                  Plain dialog which have a very very long long title overflow one row

                  Subheading which have a very long long long long long long long long sub head, really a long head

                  Text

                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For resize and drag dialog components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dialog.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  To enable the dialogs dragable, see the examples below. 

                  
    <div class="modal-header" data-drag="True">

                  To enable the dialogs resizable, see the examples below. 

                  
    <div class="modal-content" data-resize="True">
    <!----need change dialog "modal-header" structure to support resize-->
    <div class="modal-header">
        <div class="n-dialog-header-bg-filler"></div>
        <div class="n-dialog-header-resize">
            <div class="n-dialog-header-fg-filler"></div>
            <div class="n-dialog-header-curve">
                <div class="fg-mask"></div>
                <div class="bg-mask"></div>
                <div class="fg-corner"></div>
                <div class="bg-corner"></div>
            </div>
            <h1 class="modal-title" id="myModalLabel">Plain Dialog Which Have A Very Very Long Long Title Overflow One Row</h1>
        </div>
        <i role="button" class="icon icon-close-rounded" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close dialog"></i>
        <h2 class="modal-title-subheading" id="myModalLabelVersion">Subheading which have a very long long long long long long long long sub head, really a long head</h2>
    </div>

                  Dialog wizard

                  Here are the example of dialog wizard:

                  open Dialog wizard

                  Create Task

                  General data

                  • 1
                  • 2
                  • 3
                  • 4
                  Step 1 description
                  It is task 1.
                  Step 2 description
                  It is task 2.
                  Step 3 description
                  It is task 3.
                  Step 4 description
                  It is task 4.

                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For dialog wizard components, it will be ok to import following css file :
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dialog.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tabpane.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  Wizard dialogues always contain a dynamic progress bar in the header, clearly showing the number of steps in the process, and buttons at the base to navigate through those steps. To use the wizard dialog, see the examples below.

                  <!-- Dialog wizard -->
<div class="modal n-dlg-wizard" id="myWizardDialog" role="dialog" aria-labelledby="myModalDlgLabel-subhead" aria-hidden="true" tabindex='-1'>
    <div class="modal-dialog">
        <div class="modal-content">
            <div class="modal-header">
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-fg-filler"></div>
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-bg-filler"></div>
                    <div class="n-dialog-header-curve">
                        <div class="fg-mask"></div>
                        <div class="bg-mask"></div>
                        <div class="fg-corner"></div>
                        <div class="bg-corner"></div>
                    </div>
                    <i role="button" class="icon icon-close-rounded" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close wizard"></i>
                    <h1 class="modal-title" id="myModalLabel">Create Task</h1>
                    <h2 class="modal-title-subheading" id="myModalLabelVersion">General data</h2>
                </div>
            <div class="modal-body">
                <div class="navbar">
                <div class="navbar-inner">
                    <ul>
                        <li><a href="#tab1" data-toggle="tab"><span>1</span></a></li>
                        ...
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="tab-content">
                <div class="tab-pane" id="tab1">
                    <div class="n-dlg-wizard-step-description">Step 1 description</div>
                    <div class="n-dlg-wizard-step-content">It is task 1.</div>
                </div>
                ...
            </div>
            <div class="modal-footer">
                <input type='button' class='btn btn-standard button-previous' name='previous' value='Back'/>
                <input type='button' class='btn btn-standard button-next' name='next' value='Next'/>
                <input type='button' class='btn btn-standard button-last' name='last' value='Finish'/>
                <input type='button' class='btn btn-standard button-first ' name='first' value='Cancel'/>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

<!--  JS-script needed -->
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js" ></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js" ></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js" ></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js" ></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.bootstrap.wizard.js" ></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js" ></script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#mydialog').initWizard();
    });
</script>

                  Login

                  Below is a default login screen for any Nokia Solutions and Networks products.

                  BTS Site Manager

                  Version 0.0.1 beta

                  Forgot password

                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For login components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.login.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../assets/css/demo.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  For login error component, it will be ok to extra import following this another css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.alert.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                  Example HTML codes:

                  <body class="n-login-screen">...
<div class="n-login">
    <div class="n-login-logo">
        <img src="./wulfdist/img/logo.png" width="110" height="19" alt="Nokia logo"/>
    </div>
    <div class="panel panel-shadow panel-blue-cap">
        <h1 class="n-login-title">BTS Site <span class="n-product-name-blue">Manager</span></h1>

        <div class="panel-body">
            <h2 class="n-login-title-version-light">Version 0.0.1 beta</h2>

            <div class="n-login-panel-fields">
                <form class="form-horizontal" action="#" method="post">
                    <div class="form-group n-login-textfields">
                        <div class="col-sm-6 input-required">
                            <input name="username" type="text" tabindex="110" class="form-control n-inputfield" id="applicationLoginUsername" placeholder="Username">
                            <a class="form-control-feedback"><span class="icon icon-mandatory"></span></a>
                        </div>
                        <div class="col-sm-6 input-required">
                            <input name="password" type="password" tabindex="120" class="form-control n-inputfield" id="applicationLoginPassword" placeholder="Password">
                            <a class="form-control-feedback form-control-feedback"><span class="icon icon-mandatory"></span></a>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-login-action">
                        <div class="n-login-forget-password">
                            <a href="#">Forgot password</a><span class="icon icon-breadcrumb"></span>
                        </div>
                        <button type="submit" class="btn btn-defaultBlue btn-standard n-login-button" id="applicationLoginButton" disabled="true">Log In</button>
                    </div>
                </form>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</body>

                  Timezone

                  Normal

                  JS & CSS dependency:

                  For timezone components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.timezone.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                  Invoke Timezone.js by Required JS:

                  
    <script src="../assets/js/require.js"></script>
    <script src="../assets/js/require-config.js"></script>
    <script>
    require(['jquery', 'wulf_umd']);
    </script>

                  Via Javascript

                  Call the timezone control via JavaScript:

                  
    $('mySelectlistTimezone').nTimezone();

                  Via Data-API

                  Add data-markup="timezone" to the .n-timezone element that you wish to initialize on $.ready().

                  
    <div class="btn-group selectlist selectlist-resize n-timezone" data-resize="none" data-markup="timezone" id="mySelectlistTimezone">
        <button class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" type="button" aria-expanded="false">
            <span class="selected-label"></span>
            <span class="selected-caret"><span class="caret"></span></span>
            <span class="sr-only">Toggle Dropdown</span>
        </button>
        <ul class="dropdown-menu n-dropdown-menu-scroll" role="menu">
        </ul>
    </div>

                  Methods

                  .setDefault(PackedZoneString)

                  Set the default timezone to show.

                  
    $('mySelectlisttimezone').setDefault('Asia/Shanghai');

                  .addZone(PackedZoneString)

                  .addZone(PackedZoneString[])

                  Add more timezone to list. The strings passed in should be in this format: ZoneName|ZoneOffset.

                  
    $('mySelectlisttimezone').addZone('Asia/Beijing|+08:00');
    $('mySelectlisttimezone').addZone(['Asia/Beijing|+08:00', 'Europe/Oulu|+03:00']);

                  .removeZone(PackedZoneString)

                  .removeZone(PackedZoneString[])

                  Remove the timezone in list.

                  
    $('mySelectlisttimezone').removeZone('Asia/Beijing');
    $('mySelectlisttimezone').removeZone(['Asia/Beijing', 'Asia/Shanghai']);

                  Tree with folder selection

                    • Loading...

                    Tree Panel

                      • Loading...

                      JS & CSS dependency:

                      <!-- import css style and js file -->
<!-- NOTICE: always import fuelux.css -->
<link href="./wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.tree-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                      
<!-- Otherwise same as normal tree but change in js -->
<script>
$(document).ready(
 function ()
 {
	$('#myTree').tree({
		dataSource: dataSource,
		folderSelect :true
	});

	<-- get data for tree component -->
	dataSource = function(parentData, callback){//...}
 }
</script>

                      Tree with html/css

                      • All parameters
                        • Site specific
                          • Common
                            • Synchronization
                              • Management
                                • User account management+LDAP
                                  • Climate control
                                    • External alarms and controls
                                      • Management plane address
                                        • External alarms and controls
                                          • Troubleshooting administration
                                          • Antenna line management
                                            • Passive units
                                            • Transport
                                              • Physical interfaces
                                                • Ethernet switching
                                                  • Ethernet interfaces and VLANs
                                                    • IP interfaces
                                                      • Quality of Service
                                                        • IPv4 routing
                                                          • RTT measurement
                                                          • LTE
                                                            • LTE RNW configuration
                                                            • WCDMA

                                                              This component doesn't invoke any Javascript, so it is just a static CSS style definition example. 

                                                              
    <!-- JS & CSS dependency: -->
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.tree-html.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

    
                                                              
    <div class="html-tree">
        <div class="n-tree">
            <li class="">
                <a href="#">
                    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
                    <span class="icon icon-warning"></span>
                    <span class="treeContent">Common</span>
                </a>
                <ul>
                <li class="">
                    <a href="#">
                        <span class="icon"></span>
                        <span class="icon"></span>
                        <span class="treeContent">Synchronization</span>
                    </a>
                <ul></ul>
                </li>
                <li class="">
                    <a id="Management" href="#">
                        <span class="icon icon-next"></span>
                        <span class="icon icon-warning"></span>
                        <span class="treeContent">Management</span>
                    </a>
                <ul>
                <li class="selected">
                    <a>
                        <span class="icon"></span>
                        <span class="icon icon-warning"></span>
                        <span class="treeContent">User account management+LDAP</span>
                    </a>
                    <ul></ul>
                </li>
                </ul>
                </li>
                </ul>
            </li>
        </div>
    </div>

<!-- import css style and js file -->
<!-- NOTICE: always import fuelux.css -->

<link href="./wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.tree-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="demo.css" rel="stylesheet">

<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

	
                                                                    
<!-- Tree component without checkbox and with scroll -->
<div class="fuelux menu-tree">
 <ul id="myTree" class="tree tree-scroll" role="tree">
  <li class="tree-branch hide" data-template="treebranch" role="treeitem" aria-expanded="false">
   <div class="tree-branch-header">
	<a class="tree-branch-name">
	 <span class="glyphicon icon-caret glyphicon-play"></span>
	 <span class="glyphicon icon-folder glyphicon-folder-close"></span>
	 <span class="tree-label"></span>
	</a>
   </div>
   <ul class="tree-branch-children" role="group"></ul>
  <div class="tree-loader" role="alert">Loading...</div>
  </li>
  <li class="tree-item hide" data-template="treeitem" role="treeitem">
   <a class="tree-item-name"  target="content">
	<span class="glyphicon icon-item fueluxicon-bullet"></span>
	<span class="tree-label"></span>
   </a>
  </li>
 </ul>
</div>
	
                                                                    
<!-- Tree component with checkbox and scroll -->
<div class="fuelux menu-tree">
  <ul id="myTree" class="tree tree-scroll tree-has-checkbox" role="tree">
	<li class="tree-branch hide" data-template="treebranch" role="treeitem" aria-expanded="false">
	  <div class="tree-branch-header">
		<a class="tree-branch-name">
		  <span class="glyphicon icon-caret glyphicon-play"></span>
		  <span class="glyphicon icon-folder glyphicon-folder-close"></span>
		  <span class="checkbox" name="folder" >
			<input id="xx" name='folder' type="checkbox"></input>
			<label for="xx"></label>
		  </span>
		  <span class="tree-label"></span>
		</a>
	  </div>
	  <ul class="tree-branch-children" role="group"></ul>
	  <div class="tree-loader" role="alert">Loading...</div>
	</li>
	<li class="tree-item hide" data-template="treeitem" role="treeitem">
	  <a class="tree-item-name"  target="content">
		<span class="glyphicon icon-item fueluxicon-bullet"></span>
		<span class="checkbox" name="file" >
		  <input id="xx" name='file' type="checkbox"></input>
		  <label for="xx"></label>
		</span>
		<span class="tree-label"></span>
	  </a>
	</li>
  </ul>
</div>

                                                                    To enable scorllbar for tree, you can simply call enableScrollbar method for tree component. The parameters stand for the width and height of the tree component. 
                                                                    
<!-- Initiate tree data in js -->
<script>
$(document).ready(
 function ()
 {
	$('#myTree').tree({
		dataSource: dataSource,
		folderSelect :false
	});

	<-- get data for tree component -->
	dataSource = function(parentData, callback){//...}
	$('#myTree').tree('enableScrollbar', 250, 300);
 }
</script>

                                                                    To disable the tree, you can simply call disable method for tree component 
                                                                    
<script>
$(document).ready( function ()
{
	$('#myTree').tree('disable');
});
</script>

                                                                    Tree

                                                                      • Loading...

                                                                      Tree Panel

                                                                        • Loading...

                                                                        Disabled Tree Panel

                                                                          • Loading...
                                                                          
<!-- Import css style and js file -->
<!-- NOTICE: always import fuelux.css -->

<link href="./wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.tree-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="./wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="demo.css" rel="stylesheet">

<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

	
                                                                          
<!-- Tree component without checkbox -->
<div class="fuelux menu-tree">
 <ul id="myTree" class="tree" role="tree">
  <li class="tree-branch hide" data-template="treebranch" role="treeitem" aria-expanded="false">
   <div class="tree-branch-header">
	<a class="tree-branch-name">
	 <span class="glyphicon icon-caret glyphicon-play"></span>
	 <span class="glyphicon icon-folder glyphicon-folder-close"></span>
	 <span class="tree-label"></span>
	</a>
   </div>
   <ul class="tree-branch-children" role="group"></ul>
  <div class="tree-loader" role="alert">Loading...</div>
  </li>
  <li class="tree-item hide" data-template="treeitem" role="treeitem">
   <a class="tree-item-name"  target="content">
	<span class="glyphicon icon-item fueluxicon-bullet"></span>
	<span class="tree-label"></span>
   </a>
  </li>
 </ul>
</div>

	
                                                                          
<!-- Tree component with checkbox -->
<div class="fuelux menu-tree">
  <ul id="myTree" class="tree tree-has-checkbox" role="tree">
	<li class="tree-branch hide" data-template="treebranch" role="treeitem" aria-expanded="false">
	  <div class="tree-branch-header">
		<a class="tree-branch-name">
		  <span class="glyphicon icon-caret glyphicon-play"></span>
		  <span class="glyphicon icon-folder glyphicon-folder-close"></span>
		  <span class="checkbox" name="folder">
			<input id="xx" name='folder' type="checkbox"></input>
			<label for="xx"></label>
		  </span>
		  <span class="tree-label"></span>
		</a>
	  </div>
	  <ul class="tree-branch-children" role="group"></ul>
	  <div class="tree-loader" role="alert">Loading...</div>
	</li>
	<li class="tree-item hide" data-template="treeitem" role="treeitem">
	  <a class="tree-item-name"  target="content">
		<span class="glyphicon icon-item fueluxicon-bullet"></span>
		<span class="checkbox" name="file" >
		  <input id="xx" name='file' type="checkbox"></input>
		  <label for="xx"></label>
		</span>
		<span class="tree-label"></span>
	  </a>
	</li>
  </ul>
</div>

	
                                                                          
<!-- initiate tree data in js -->
<script>
$(document).ready( function ()
{
	$('#myTree').tree({
		dataSource: dataSource,
		folderSelect :true
	});

	<-- get data for tree component -->
	dataSource = function(parentData, callback){//...}
});
</script>

                                                                          To disable the tree, you can simply call disable method for tree component. 
                                                                          
<script>
$(document).ready( function ()
{
	$('#myTree').tree('disable');
});
</script>

                                                                          Tree table

                                                                          Grid tree table

                                                                          Feature: no alternating rows; single selection


                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Tree table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdatatable.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxtreegrid.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="treeTable-grid"></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
    $(document).ready( function() {
    var employees = [
    { "ID": 1, "parent": 2, "FirstName": "Nancy", "LastName": "Davolio", "Country": "China", "BirthDate": "1948-12-08
    00:00:00", "City": "Seattle", "Address": "507 - 20th Ave. E.Apt. 2A" },
    { "ID": 2, "parent": null, "FirstName": "Andrew", "LastName": "Fuller", "Country": "USA", "BirthDate": "1952-02-19
    00:00:00", "City": "Tacoma", "Address": "908 W. Capital Way" },
    { "ID": 3, "parent": 2, "FirstName": "Janet", "LastName": "Leverling", "Country": "USA", "BirthDate": "1963-08-30
    00:00:00", "City": "Kirkland", "Address": "722 Moss Bay Blvd." }, ... ];

    // prepare the data
    var source =
    {
    dataType: "json",
    dataFields: [{ name: 'ID', type: 'number' }, { name: 'parent', type: 'number' }, { name: 'FirstName', type: 'string'
    },...],
    hierarchy: { keyDataField: { name: 'ID' }, parentDataField: { name: 'parent' } },
    id: 'ID',
    localData: employees
    };

    var columns = [
    { text: 'FirstName', dataField: 'FirstName', minWidth: 110},
    { text: 'LastName', dataField: 'LastName', minWidth: 85},
    { text: 'Birth Date', dataField: 'BirthDate', cellsFormat: 'd', minWidth: 85},
    { text: 'Address', dataField: 'Address', width:250, minWidth: 210},
    { text: 'City', dataField: 'City' , minWidth: 75},
    { text: 'Country', dataField: 'Country', minWidth: 70}
    ];
    var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);
    // create Tree Grid
    $("#treeTable-grid").jqxTreeGrid(
    {
    width: '100%',
    height: 200,
    source: dataAdapter,
    selectionMode:'singleRow',
    scrollBarSize: 8,
    columnsResize: true,
    columns: columns
    });
    </script>

                                                                          No-grid tree table

                                                                          Feature: alternating rows; multi selection; resizable column


                                                                          
    <div id="treeTable-no-grid" class="no-grid-line"></div>

    <script>
    var newDataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);
    $("#treeTable-no-grid").jqxTreeGrid({
    altRows: true, //alternating rows
    width: '100%',
    height: 200,
    source: newDataAdapter,
    pageable:false,
    sortable:false,
    selectionMode:'multiRow', //multi selection
    enableBrowserSelection: false,
    columnsResize:true, //resizable column
    scrollBarSize: 8,
    columns: columns
    });
    </script>

                                                                          For more information about this component, see jqwidget documentation about jqxTreeGrid and API.

                                                                          Validations

                                                                          Here are examples of different kinds of validations:

                                                                          DD/MM/YYYY
                                                                          HH:MM:SS

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For validations components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
                                                                          
<!-- IP Address validation-->
<div class="form-group">
    <label class="control-label" style="width: 175px">IP address:</label>
    <input type="text" class="n-inputfield-validation n-inputfield-ip-address n-inputfield">
</div>

<!-- Customized validation-->
    <div class="form-group">
    <label class="control-label" style="width: 175px">Customized validation:</label>
    <input type="text" class="n-inputfield-validation n-inputfield-customized n-inputfield">
</div>
                                                                          Jquery based validation support deliver your regex to validation. 
                                                                          
require(['jquery', 'wulf_umd'], function($){
    $('.customized').customerReg(/^[1-9]{3}d*$/);
});

                                                                          File upload

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For file upload components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                          
	<div class="n-file-upload">
		<input type="file" id="file-input" tabindex="-1"/>
		<button class="btn btn-standard" id="file-input-btn">Name for the button</button>
	</div>

                                                                          Flyout activity area

                                                                          Messenger

                                                                          Jeff 1hr

                                                                          Hi,how are you doing? lolololololol balabala

                                                                          Tommy 1d

                                                                          Hi,how are you doing? What a good day! shall we play basketball? balabalabalabalabalabala

                                                                          Tommy 5hr

                                                                          Hi,how are you doing? What a good day! shall we go to the beach? valavalalvalvalvalvalval long long long long long conversation balabalabalabalabalabala

                                                                          Jeff 3hr

                                                                          Hi,how are you doing? What a good day! shall we go to the beach? valavalalvalvalvalvalval long long long long long conversation balabalabalabalabalabala

                                                                          Messenger

                                                                            Tab two content

                                                                          CSS dependency:

                                                                              For flyout activate area components,it will be ok to import following css file:
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.flyoutactivityarea.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                          Flyout activity area is a flyout menu. So we use flyout markup data-markup="flyout". the flyout activity area is indicated by a vertical tab positioned along the left edge of the interface. It expands to the right.These areas can be grouped as tabs, similar to the drawer. 

                                                                          
    <div class="n-flyout" id="myFlyoutActiveArea" data-markup="flyout" data-direction="right" data-expand="false">
        <div data-target-selector="#one" class="n-flyout-container n-flyout-activity-area">
            <div class="n-flyout-activity">
                <div class="panel">
                    <div class="panel-heading">
                        <h1>Messenger</h1>
                        <span>class="icon icon-settings"></span>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="n-flyout-content flyout-scoll" style="height: 400px;">
