                    <div class="n-flyout-message-left">
                        <div class="content">
                            <span class="icon icon-profile"></span>
                            <a href="#" class="n-link"><span>Jeff</span></a>
                            <span class="time">1hr</span>
                            <p>
                                Hi,how are you doing?
                                What a good day!
                                balabalabalabalabalabala
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="n-flyout-message-right">
                        <div class="content">
                            <span class="icon icon-profile"></span>
                            <a href="#" class="n-link"><span>Tommy</span></a>
                            <span class="time">1d</span>
                            <p>
                                Hi,how are you doing?
                                What a good day!
                                balabalabalabalabalabala
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="n-flyout-foot">
                <input id="Example1" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield"
               placeholder="Label inside">
            </div>
        </div>

        <div data-target-selector="#two" class="n-flyout-container n-flyout-activity-area">
            <div class="n-flyout-activity">
                <div class="panel">
                    <div class="panel-heading">
                    <h1>Messenger</h1>
                    <span>class="icon icon-settings"></span>
                </div>
                <div class="n-flyout-content" style="height: 400px;">
                    <ul>
                        Tab two content
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="n-flyout-foot">
                <input id="Example1" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield" placeholder="Label inside">
            </div>
        </div>
        <ul class="n-flyout-open n-flyout-activity-area-tabs">
            <li>
                <a href="#one"><span class="border-container"><i class="icon icon-bubble"></i></span></a>
            <li>
            <li>
                <a href="#two"><span class="border-container"><i class="icon icon-list"></i></span></a>
            <li>
        <ul>
    </div>

                                                                          Flyout menu

                                                                          • Customer Care Automation
                                                                          • Troubleticket System
                                                                          • Map Tool
                                                                          • Intranet
                                                                          • Knowledge Database

                                                                          When available, the flyout menu is indicated by a vertical tab positioned along the left edge of the interface. It expands to the right.

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For flyoutmenu components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.flyout.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                          
    <div class="n-flyout" id="myFlyout">
    <div class="n-flyout-container">
        <ul class="n-flyout-menu">
            <li><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span>Customer Care Automation</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span>Troubleticket System</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span>Map Tool</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span>Intranet</span></a></li>
            <li><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span>Knowledge Database</span></a></li>
        </ul>
    </div>
    <a class="n-flyout-open" href="javascript:void(0)">
        <span class="middle"><i class="icon icon-list"></i></span>
    </a>
    </div>

                                                                          To pre-select a list item, add the class "selected". Otherwise, the top-most item will be selected. 

                                                                          
    <li class="selected"><a href="javascript:void(0)"><span>Map Tool</span></a></li>

                                                                          For AJAX generated scripts, the tooltip can be initialized via Javascript: 

                                                                          
    $("#myNewFlyout").nFlyout();

                                                                          Consumer Footer

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For footer components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.footer.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          To create a consumer footer, firstly, contents that are non-footer are wrapped in n-footer-wrapper. Place contents of the footer inside n-footer or n-footer-bordered. Place footer links in the footer inside n-footer-left. Add copyright inside n-footer-right as normal. Then add n-footer-icons inside n-footer-right and add images wrapped with item-icon inside n-footer-icons as seen in the code sample below. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Page content wrapper -->
    <div class="n-footer-wrapper">
        <!-- page items -->
    </div>

    <!-- Basic footer -->
    <div class="n-footer">
        <div class="n-footer-left">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#" class="n-footer-links">Link 1</a></li>
                <li><a href="#" class="n-footer-links">Link 2</a></li>
                <li><a href="#" class="n-footer-links">Link 3</a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="n-footer-right">
            <div class="n-footer-copyright">
                © 2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.
            </div>
            <div class="n-footer-icons">
                <a class="item-icon">
                    <img src="../assets/images/wulf.png">
                </a>
                <a class="item-icon">
                    <img src="../assets/images/wulf.png">
                </a>
                <a class="item-icon">
                    <img src="../assets/images/wulf.png">
                </a>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
                                                                          • Link 1
                                                                          • Link 2
                                                                          • Link 3
                                                                          © 2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.

                                                                          Footer

                                                                          To use a footer, contents that are non-footer is wrapped in n-footer-wrapper. Then contents of the footer are placed inside n-footer or n-footer-bordered. See the subpages for detailed examples. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Page content wrapper -->
    <div class="n-footer-wrapper">
        <!-- page items -->
    </div>

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For footer components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.footer.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          Footer with copyright

                                                                          To create a copyright footer, firstly, contents that are non-footer are wrapped in n-footer-wrapper. Place contents of the footer inside n-footer or n-footer-bordered. Then add copyright by placing it inside n-footer-right as seen in the code sample below which uses a non-bordered footer. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Page content wrapper -->
    <div class="n-footer-wrapper">
        <!-- page items -->
    </div>

    <!-- Basic footer -->
    <div class="n-footer">
        <div class="n-footer-right">
            <div class="n-footer-copyright">
                © 2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
                                                                          If want border line for the footer, add n-footer-bordered around the footer. 
                                                                          
    <!-- Bordered footer -->
    <div class="n-footer-bordered">
        <div class="n-footer-right">
            <div class="n-footer-copyright">
                © 2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For footer components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.footer.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
                                                                          ©2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.

                                                                          Footer bordered with links

                                                                          To create a footer with links, firstly, contents that are non-footer are wrapped in n-footer-wrapper. Place contents of the footer inside n-footer or n-footer-bordered. Place footer links in the footer inside n-footer-left whose links have the class name n-footer-links. Copyright is placed inside n-footer-right as normal. 

                                                                          
    <div class="n-footer-wrapper">
        <!-- page items -->
    </div>

    <!--Bordered footer with links -->
    <div class="n-footer-bordered">
        <div class="n-footer-left">
            <ul>
                <li><a href="#" class="n-footer-links">Link 1</a></li>
                <li><a href="#" class="n-footer-links">Link 2</a></li>
                <li><a href="#" class="n-footer-links">Link 3</a></li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="n-footer-right">
            <div class="n-footer-copyright">
                ©2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For footer components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.footer.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
                                                                          • Link 1
                                                                          • Link 2
                                                                          • Link 3
                                                                          ©2016 Nokia. All rights reserved.

                                                                          Form

                                                                          These forms are for testing labels and different controls in basic use.

                                                                          Normal horizontal form

                                                                          • Male
                                                                          • Female

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For form components, it will be ok to import following css file :
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.combobox.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
                                                                          
    <!-- Normal horizontal form -->
    <form class="form-horizontal">
        <div class="form-group">
            <label class="col-sm-4 control-label">Password:</label>
            <div class="col-sm-8">
                <input type="password" class="form-control n-inputfield" id="exInputPw1" placeholder="<Password>">
            </div>
        </div>  ...
        <div class="form-group">
            <label class="col-sm-4 control-label">Selectable values:</label>
            <div class="col-sm-4">
                <div class="checkbox">
                    <input id="val1" type="checkbox" checked>
                    <label for="val1">Value 1</label>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="col-sm-4">
                <div class="checkbox">
                    <input id="val2" type="checkbox">
                    <label for="val2">Value 2</label>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </form>

                                                                          Small horizontal form

                                                                          
    <!-- Small horizontal form -->
    <form class="form-horizontal">
        <div class="form-group">
            <label class="col-sm-4 control-label-sm">Password:</label>
            <div class="col-sm-8">
                <input type="password" class="form-control n-inputfield n-inputfield-small" id="exInputPwSm" placeholder="<Password>">
            </div>
        </div> ...
        <div class="form-group">
            <label class="col-sm-4 control-label-sm">Small selectable:</label>
            <div class="col-sm-4">
                <div class="checkbox checkbox-small">
                    <input id="smallVal1" type="checkbox" checked>
                    <label for="smallVal1">Small value 1</label>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="col-sm-4">
                <div class="checkbox checkbox-small">
                    <input id="smallVal2" type="checkbox">
                    <label for="smallVal2">Small value 2</label>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </form>

                                                                          Form with labels above the control

                                                                          • Male
                                                                          • Female
                                                                          
    <!-- Form with labels above the control -->
    <form class="form-horizontal">
        <div class="form-group has-feedback">
            <label class="col-sm-12">Email address::</label>
            <div class="col-sm-8">
                <input type="email" class="form-control n-inputfield" id="exInputEmail2" placeholder="Email 2">
                <a class="form-control-feedback"><span class="icon icon-mandatory"></span></a>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="form-group">
            <label class="col-sm-12">Password:</label>
            <div class="col-sm-8">
                <input type="password" class="form-control n-inputfield" id="exInputPw2" placeholder="Password 2">
            </div>
        </div> ...
        <div class="form-group">
            <div class="col-sm-12">
                <label>Small selectable:</label>
                <div class="checkbox">
                    <input id="smallVal3" type="checkbox">
                    <label for="smallVal3">Small value 1</label>
                </div>
                <div class="checkbox">
                    <input id="smallVal4" type="checkbox" checked>
                    <label for="smallVal4">Small value 2</label>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-sm-12">
            <button type="button" class="btn pull-right">Submit</button>
        </div></form>

                                                                          Table (JQWidget) - Add and Remove Rows

                                                                          Table with add/delete rows using table with row selection.

                                                                          Table with add/delete rows using table with scroll.


                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For table(JQWidget)-add-remove-rows components,you can use following css import code:
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
        
                                                                              
        This is based on the standard Table(jqWidget).

        Add buttons to your table:

        <div id="table-alternating-row-selection" class="grid-alternating-rows n-table-hover n-jqxgrid-table"></div>
        <div class="grid-button-container">
            <button class="btn btn-small" id="add-row">New Row</button>
            <button class="btn btn-small" id="del-row">Delete</button>
        </div>

        Add addrow and deleterow functions to the source:

        var source=
        {
            localdata: data,
            datatype: "array",
            //Additional code here

            addrow: function (rowid, rowdata, position, commit) {
                // synchronize with the server - send insert command
                // call commit with parameter true if the synchronization with the server is successful
                // and with parameter false if the synchronization failed.
                // you can pass additional argument to the commit callback which represents the new ID if it is generated from a DB.
                commit(true);
            },

             deleterow: function (rowid, commit) {
                // synchronize with the server - send delete command
                // call commit with parameter true if the synchronization with the server is successful
                // and with parameter false if the synchronization failed.
                commit(true);
            }
        };

        var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);
        var tableAltRowSel = $("#table-alternating-row-selection-default");

        tableAltRowSel.jqxGrid({
            width: 1150,
            autoheight: true,
            source: dataAdapter,
            editable: true,

            //Additional Code Here

            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
            ready: function(){
            }
        });

        //You can then attach the blow functions to the buttons you created.
        $('#add-row').on('click', function () {
            $.grid.nAddRow(tableAltRowSel, generaterow());
        });
        $('#del-row').on('click', function () {
            $.grid.nDelRow(tableAltRowSel);
        });

        Usage:
        $.grid.nAddRow(grid, rowData);
        $.grid.nDelRow(grid);

        References:
        For full source of the script for JQWidget Table, see Table (jqWidget).
        JQWidgets Grid Example (Create, Remove, Update): Link
        Example: Link

                                                                          To enable the inline delete button on grid cells:

                                                                              
        Use $.grid.nDeleteButtonOnCellRenderer as the cell renderer on a column:
        {
            text: 'Cancel',
            columntype: 'custom',
            datafield: 'cancel',
            cellsrenderer: $.grid.nDeleteButtonOnCellRenderer,
            width: 100,
            minWidth: 60
        }

        Aside from adding deleterow function to the source,
        You need to enable it on the jqxGrid ready function by using $.grid.nEnableDeleteButtonOnCell(grid):

        ready: function(){
            $.grid.nAttachAddRowButton(tableAltRowSelCustom,'#add-row', generaterow);
            $.grid.nAttachDelRowButton(tableAltRowSelCustom,'#del-row');
            $.grid.nEnableDeleteButtonOnCell(tableAltRowSelCustom);
        }

                                                                          Table (JQWidget)

                                                                          Standard table with error header row


                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For table(JQWidget) with error components,you can use following css import code:
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          Before we add the error head row, we need to assign the error cells. To do that, we should define cellrender for column that may contain error data.

                                                                          
    <script>
    $(document).ready( function() {
        ...
        var columns = [
            ...
            {
                text: 'Alarm number',
                columntype: 'NumberInput',
                datafield: 'alarmnumber',
                filtertype: 'number',
                cellsalign: 'right',
                align: "right",
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nNumberCellRenderer, // For column type is number
                width: 150
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm text',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'alarmtext',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nStringCellRenderer, // For column type is string
                width: 180
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm time',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'alarmtime',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nStringCellRenderer,
                width: 150
            },
            ...
        ]
        ...
    });
    </script>

                                                                          Then for the error data, we have special definition.

                                                                          
    <script>
    $(document).ready( function() {
        ...
        data[0] = {
        severity: 'icon-fault-critical',
        name: 'Avatar',
        alarmnumber: '((113211))', // For number type data, we use double bracket to sign it as error data.
        alarmtext: 'System module error#errordata#', // For string type data, we use suffix "#errordata#" to sign it as error data. (So the "#errordata#" should be kept as reserved word)
        alarmtime: "1985/03/26",
        acknowledgment: "false",
        server: 'nokia',
        cancel: 'icon-fault-critical'
        };
        ...
    });
    </script>

                                                                          After that, the only thing we need to do is adding the extra javascript statement as below:

                                                                          
    <script>
        $(document).ready( function() {
            $("#table-error-head").jqxGrid({
                width: 1160,
                height: 200,
                source: dataAdapter,
                editable: true,
                editmode: 'click',
                selectionmode: 'singlecell',
                enableBrowserSelection: false,
                autoshowcolumnsmenubutton: true,
                altRows: true,
                columns: columns,
                scrollBarSize: 8,
                rowsheight: 26,
                columnsheight: 26,
                handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                    return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
                }
            });
            $.grid.enableErrorHeaderRow("table-error-head");
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Standard table with header error indicator


                                                                          To add error indicator in column header instead of the error header, the only different is to change the javascript statement as below:

                                                                          
    <script>
        $(document).ready( function() {
            $("#table-header-error-indicator").jqxGrid({
            width: 1160,
            height: 200,
            source: dataAdapter,
            editable: true,
            editmode: 'click',
            selectionmode: 'singlecell',
            enableBrowserSelection: false,
            autoshowcolumnsmenubutton: true,
            altRows: true,
            columns: columns,
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
            });
            $.grid.enableHeadErrorIndicator("table-header-error-indicator");
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Table (JQWidget) with filters DRAFT


                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.dropdown.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxmenu.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcheckbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxlistbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdropdownlist.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.edit.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.selection.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.filter.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.pager.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.sort.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="table-filter" class="n-jqxgrid-table"></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
    $(document).ready( function() {
    /*---------------- test data ----------------*/
    var data = new Array();
    data[0] = {
    name: 'Avatar',
    alarmnumber: '113211',
    alarmtext: 'System module error',
    alarmtime: "1985/03/26"
    };
    ...

    var source =
    {
    localdata: data,
    datafields:
    [
    {name: 'name', type: 'string'},
    {name: 'alarmnumber', type: 'number'},
    {name: 'alarmtext', type: 'string'},
    {name: 'alarmtime', type: 'string'}
    ],
    datatype: "array"
    };

    var columns = [
    {text: 'Distinguished Name',columntype: 'custom',datafield: 'name',cellsrenderer: $.grid.nTextFieldCellRenderer,
    createeditor: $.grid.nCreateTextFieldEditor,initeditor:$.grid.nInitTextFieldEditor,geteditorvalue:
    $.grid.nGetTextFieldEditorValue},
    {text: 'Alarm Number', datafield: 'alarmnumber',cellsalign: 'right', align:"right"},
    {
    text: 'Alarm Text', columntype: 'textbox', datafield: 'alarmtext', filtertype: 'list',
    width: 160,
    createfilterwidget: $.grid.dropdownFilterRender
    },
    {
    text: 'Alarm Time', columntype: 'textbox', datafield: 'alarmtime', filtertype: 'list',
    width: 160,
    createfilterwidget: $.grid.dropdownFilterRender
    }
    ]

    var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);

    $("#table-filter").jqxGrid(
    {
    width: 650,
    height:250,
    source: dataAdapter,
    showfilterrow: true,
    filterable: true,
    pageable: true,
    selectionmode: 'multiplecellsextended',
    columns: columns,
    localization: $.grid.dropdownFilterString,
    pagerheight: 40,
    pagerrenderer: $.grid.pagerrenderer.bind(null, "#table-filter")//#table-filter is the table id
    handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
        return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
    }
    });
    </script>

                                                                          The following example show filter and page at the same time based on the first filter table code.


                                                                          
    <div id="table-filter-page" class="n-jqxgrid-table"></div>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcombobox.js"></script>
    <script>
    $("#table-filter-page").jqxGrid(
    {
    ...
    pagerrenderer: $.grid.pagerrenderer.bind(null, "#table-filter-page", true);
    });
    </script>

                                                                          Table (JQWidget) with change indicator

                                                                          Standard table with change indicator by row


                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxmenu.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcheckbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxlistbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdropdownlist.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.edit.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.selection.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element with class n-jqxgrid-table within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="table-grid-indicator-by-row" class="n-jqxgrid-table"></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
    $(document).ready( function() {
        /*---------------- image render/editor ----------------*/
        var imagerenderer = function (row, datafield, value) {
        return '***';
    };
    /*---------------- test data ----------------*/
    var data = new Array();
    data[0] = {
        severity: 'icon-fault-critical',
        name: 'Avatar',
        alarmnumber: '113211',
        alarmtext: 'System module error',
        alarmtime: "1985/03/26",
        acknowledgment: "false",
        server: 'nokia'
    };
    ...

    var source =
    {
        localdata: data,
        datafields: [
            {name: 'indicator', type: 'Image'},
            {name: 'severity', type: 'Image'},
            {name: 'name', type: 'string'},
            {name: 'alarmnumber', type: 'number'},
            {name: 'alarmtext', type: 'string'},
            {name: 'alarmtime', type: 'string'},
            {name: 'acknowledgment', type: 'bool'},
            {name: 'server', type: 'string'},
        ],
        datatype: "array"
    };
    var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);

    var columns = [
        {
            text: '',
            columntype: 'textbox',
            datafield: 'indicator',
            filtertype: 'input',
            cellsrenderer: $.grid.indicatorRenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-row"), // This parameter should be same as grid ID
            width: 24
        },
        {
            text: 'Severity',
            columntype: 'textbox',
            datafield: 'severity',
            filtertype: 'input',
            cellsrenderer: imagerenderer,
            width: 100
        },
        {
            text: 'Distinguished name',
            columntype: 'custom',
            datafield: 'name',
            filtertype: 'input',
            cellsrenderer: $.grid.nIndicatorTextFieldCellRenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-row"), // This parameter should be same as grid ID
            createeditor: $.grid.nCreateIndicatorTextFieldEditor,
            initeditor: $.grid.nInitIndicatorTextFieldEditor,
            geteditorvalue: $.grid.nGetIndicatorTextFieldEditorValue,
            width: 200
        },
        {
            text: 'Alarm number',
            columntype: 'NumberInput',
            datafield: 'alarmnumber',
            filtertype: 'number',
            cellsalign: 'right',
            align: "right",
            width: 150
        },
        {
            text: 'Alarm text',
            columntype: 'textbox',
            datafield: 'alarmtext',
            filtertype: 'input',
            width: 180
        },
        {
            text: 'Alarm time',
            columntype: 'textbox',
            datafield: 'alarmtime',
            filtertype: 'input',
            width: 150
        },
        {
            text: 'Acknowledgment',
            columntype: 'custom',
            datafield: 'acknowledgment',
            filtertype: 'bool',
            width: 150,
            cellsrenderer: $.grid.nIndicatorCheckboxCellsrenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-row", "Option"), // The first parameter should be same as grid ID
            createeditor: $.grid.nCreateIndicatorCheckboxEditor("Option"),
            initeditor: $.grid.nInitIndicatorCheckboxEditor,
            geteditorvalue: $.grid.nGetIndicatorCheckboxEditorValue
        },
        {
            text: 'Server',
            columntype: 'custom',
            datafield: 'server',
            filtertype: 'input',
            width: 180,
            cellsrenderer: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistCellsrenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-row"), // This parameter should be same as grid ID
            createeditor: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistEditor(['nokia', 'nsn', 'huawei', 'reebook', 'nike', 'dahua']),
            initeditor: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistInitEditor,
            geteditorvalue: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistEditorValue
        }
    ]

    // initialize jqxGrid
    $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid(
    {
        width: 1150,
        height: 200,
        source: dataAdapter,
        editable: true,
        editmode: 'click',
        enableBrowserSelection: true,
        selectionMode: 'singlerow',
        columns: columns,
        scrollBarSize: 8,
        rowsheight: 26,
        handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
            return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
        }
    });
    $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'indicator', 'editable', false);
    $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'severity', 'editable', false);
    $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'alarmnumber', 'editable', false);
    $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'alarmtext', 'editable', false);
    $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'alarmtime', 'editable', false);

    $.grid.indicatorRowSelectRenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-row"); // This parameter should be same as grid ID

    </script>

                                                                          Standard table with change indicator by cell


                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxmenu.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcheckbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxlistbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdropdownlist.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.edit.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.selection.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element with class n-jqxgrid-table within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="table-grid-indicator-by-cell" class="n-jqxgrid-table"></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
        $(document).ready( function() {
        /*---------------- image render/editor ----------------*/
        var imagerenderer = function (row, datafield, value) {
        return '***';
        };
        /*---------------- test data ----------------*/
        var data = new Array();
        data[0] = {
            severity: 'icon-fault-critical',
            name: 'Avatar',
            alarmnumber: '113211',
            alarmtext: 'System module error',
            alarmtime: "1985/03/26",
            acknowledgment: "false",
            server: 'nokia'
        };
        ...

        var source =
        {
            localdata: data,
            datafields: [
                {name: 'severity', type: 'Image'},
                {name: 'name', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'alarmnumber', type: 'number'},
                {name: 'alarmtext', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'alarmtime', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'acknowledgment', type: 'bool'},
                {name: 'server', type: 'string'},
            ],
            datatype: "array"
        };
        var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);

        var columnsByCell = [
            {
                text: 'Severity',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'severity',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: imagerenderer,
                width: 100
            },
            {
                text: 'Distinguished name',
                columntype: 'custom',
                datafield: 'name',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nIndicatorTextFieldCellRenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell"), // This parameter should be same as grid ID
                createeditor: $.grid.nCreateIndicatorTextFieldEditor,
                initeditor: $.grid.nInitIndicatorTextFieldEditor,
                geteditorvalue: $.grid.nGetIndicatorTextFieldEditorValue,
                width: 200
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm number',
                columntype: 'NumberInput',
                datafield: 'alarmnumber',
                filtertype: 'number',
                cellsalign: 'right',
                align: "right",
                width: 150
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm text',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'alarmtext',
                filtertype: 'input',
                width: 180
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm time',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'alarmtime',
                filtertype: 'input',
                width: 150
            },
            {
                text: 'Acknowledgment',
                columntype: 'custom',
                datafield: 'acknowledgment',
                filtertype: 'bool',
                width: 150,
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nIndicatorCheckboxCellsrenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell", "Option"), // The first parameter should be same as grid ID
                createeditor: $.grid.nCreateIndicatorCheckboxEditor("Option"),
                initeditor: $.grid.nInitIndicatorCheckboxEditor,
                geteditorvalue: $.grid.nGetIndicatorCheckboxEditorValue
            },
            {
                text: 'Server',
                columntype: 'custom',
                datafield: 'server',
                filtertype: 'input',
                width: 180,
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistCellsrenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell"), // This parameter should be same as grid ID
                createeditor: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistEditor(['nokia', 'nsn', 'huawei', 'reebook', 'nike', 'dahua']),
                initeditor: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistInitEditor,
                geteditorvalue: $.grid.indicatorDropdownlistEditorValue
            }
        ]

        // initialize jqxGrid
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-row").jqxGrid(
        {
            width: 1130,
            height: 200,
            source: dataAdapter,
            editable: true,
            editmode: 'click',
            enableBrowserSelection: true,
            selectionMode: 'singlerow',
            columns: columnsByCell,
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
        });
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'indicator', 'editable', false);
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'severity', 'editable', false);
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'alarmnumber', 'editable', false);
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'alarmtext', 'editable', false);
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'alarmtime', 'editable', false);

        $.grid.indicatorRowSelectRenderer("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell"); // This parameter should be same as grid ID

        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'name', 'indicator', true);
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'acknowledgment', 'indicator', true);
        $("#table-grid-indicator-by-cell").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'server', 'indicator', true);
    </script>

                                                                          Table (JQWidget) with paging


                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqwidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxmenu.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcheckbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxlistbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdropdownlist.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.edit.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.selection.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.pager.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcombobox.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="table-paging"></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
        $(document).ready( function() {
        /*---------------- test data ----------------*/
        var data = new Array();
        data[0] = {
        name: 'Avatar',
        alarmnumber: '113211',
        alarmtext: 'System module error',
        alarmtime: "1985/03/26"
        };
        ...

        var source =
        {
        localdata: data,
        datafields:
        [
        {name: 'name', type: 'string'},
        {name: 'alarmnumber', type: 'number'},
        {name: 'alarmtext', type: 'string'},
        {name: 'alarmtime', type: 'string'}
        ],
        datatype: "array"
        };

        var columns = [
        {text: 'Distinguished Name',datafield: 'name'},
        {text: 'Alarm Number', datafield: 'alarmnumber',cellsalign: 'right', align:"right"},
        {
        text: 'Alarm Text', datafield: 'alarmtext', width: 200},
        {
        text: 'Alarm Time', datafield: 'alarmtime'}
        ]

        var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);

        $("#table-paging").jqxGrid(
        {
            width: 700,
            height:330,
            source: dataAdapter,
            showfilterrow: true,
            selectionmode: 'multiplecellsextended',
            columns: columns,
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            pageable: true,
            pagerheight: 40,
            pagerrenderer: $.grid.pagerrenderer.bind(null, "#table-paging"),
            
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
            
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Table (JQWidget) with sorter

                                                                          Standard table with alternating rows and cell selection



                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxmenu.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcheckbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxlistbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdropdownlist.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.sort.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.edit.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.selection.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element with class n-jqxgrid-table within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="table-alternating-cell-selection" class="n-jqxgrid-table"></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
        $(document).ready( function() {
            // initialize jqxGrid
            $("#table-alternating-cell-selection").jqxGrid(
            {
                width: 1150,
                height:190,
                source: dataAdapter,
                columnsmenuwidth: 0,
                sortable: true,
                editable: true,
                editmode: 'click',
                selectionmode: 'singlecell',
                enableBrowserSelection: false,
                autoshowcolumnsmenubutton: true,
                altRows: true,
                columns: columns,
                scrollBarSize: 8,
                rowsheight: 26,
                columnsheight: 26,
                handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                    return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
                }
            });
            $("#jqxgrid-alternating-cell-selection").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'severity', 'editable', false);
    </script>

                                                                          Table (JQWidget)

                                                                          Standard table with alternating rows and cell selection


                                                                          The first step is to add links to the javascript files and css dependencies to your project. Table widget requires the following files:

                                                                          
    <link href="./css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="./css/wulf.table-jqWidget.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcore.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxbuttons.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxscrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxmenu.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxcheckbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxlistbox.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdropdownlist.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.edit.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.columnsresize.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.columnsreorder.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.selection.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxpanel.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/wulf.min.js"></script>

                                                                          The next step is to create a DIV element with the class n-jqxgrid-table within the body of the html document.

                                                                          
    <div id="table-alternating-cell-selection" class="n-jqxgrid-table" ></div>

                                                                          The last step is to initialize the widget. 

                                                                          
    <script>
    $(document).ready( function() {
        /*---------------- image render/editor ----------------*/
        var imagerenderer = function (row, datafield, value) {
            return '***';
        };
        /*---------------- test data ----------------*/
        var data = new Array();
        data[0] = {
        severity: 'icon-fault-critical',
        name: 'Avatar',
        alarmnumber: '113211',
        alarmtext: 'System module error',
        alarmtime: "1985/03/26",
        acknowledgment: "true",
        server: 'nokia',
        cancel: 'icon-fault-critical'
        };
        ...

        var source =
        {
            localdata: data,
            datafields: [
                {name: 'severity', type: 'Image'},
                {name: 'name', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'alarmnumber', type: 'number'},
                {name: 'alarmtext', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'alarmtime', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'acknowledgment', type: 'bool'},
                {name: 'server', type: 'string'},
                {name: 'cancel', type: 'Image'}
            ],
            datatype: "array"
        };
        var dataAdapter = new $.jqx.dataAdapter(source);
        var columns = [
            {
                text: 'Severity',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'severity',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: imagerenderer,
                width: 100,
                minWidth: 70
            },
            {
                text: 'Distinguished name',
                columntype: 'custom',
                datafield: 'name',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nTextFieldCellRenderer,
                createeditor: $.grid.nCreateTextFieldEditor,
                initeditor: $.grid.nInitTextFieldEditor,
                geteditorvalue: $.grid.nGetTextFieldEditorValue,
                width: 200,
                minWidth: 150
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm number',
                columntype: 'NumberInput',
                datafield: 'alarmnumber',
                filtertype: 'number',
                cellsalign: 'right',
                align: "right",
                width: 150,
                minWidth: 110
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm text',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'alarmtext',
                filtertype: 'input',
                width: 180,
                minWidth: 150
            },
            {
                text: 'Alarm time',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'alarmtime',
                filtertype: 'input',
                width: 150,
                minWidth: 100
            },
            {
                text: 'Acknowledgment',
                columntype: 'custom',
                datafield: 'acknowledgment',
                filtertype: 'bool',
                width: 150,
                minWidth: 130
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.nCheckboxCellsrenderer("Option"),
                createeditor: $.grid.nCreateCheckboxEditor("Option"),
                initeditor: $.grid.nInitCheckboxEditor,
                geteditorvalue: $.grid.nGetCheckboxEditorValue
            },
            {
                text: 'Server',
                columntype: 'custom',
                datafield: 'server',
                filtertype: 'input',
                width: 180,
                minWidth: 110
                cellsrenderer: $.grid.dropdownlistCellsrenderer,
                createeditor: $.grid.dropdownlistEditor(['nokia', 'nsn', 'huawei', 'reebook', 'nike', 'dahua']),
                initeditor: $.grid.dropdownlistInitEditor,
                geteditorvalue: $.grid.dropdownlistEditorValue
            },
            {
                text: 'Cancel',
                columntype: 'textbox',
                datafield: 'cancel',
                filtertype: 'input',
                cellsrenderer: imagerenderer,
                width: 100,
                minWidth: 60
            }
        ]
        // initialize jqxGrid
        $("#table-alternating-cell-selection").jqxGrid(
        {
            width: 1150,
            height:190,
            source: dataAdapter,
            editable: true,
            columnsResize: true, //columns resizable
            columnsreorder: true, //reorder columns
            editmode: 'click',
            selectionmode: 'singlecell',
            enableBrowserSelection: false,
            autoshowcolumnsmenubutton: true,
            altRows: true,
            columns: columns,
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
        });
        $("#jqxgrid-alternating-cell-selection").jqxGrid('setcolumnproperty', 'severity', 'editable', false);
</script>
        
                                                                              To support data export:

    First, add following dependency js file:
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxgrid.export.js"></script>
    <script src="./js/dependencies/jqxdata.export.js"></script>

    Then, invoke the exportdata method:
    $("#jqxgrid-alternating-cell-selection").jqxGrid('exportdata', 'json', 'dataFileName');
    
                                                                              Enable or disable table:

    User can enable or disable table by using $("#gridId").jqxGrid({disabled: true}) or $("#gridId").jqxGrid({disabled: false});
    Then need to refresh the table to update the component in table cell by using $("#gridId").jqxGrid("refresh");

                                                                          Standard table with alternating rows and row selection


                                                                          
    <div id="table-alternating-row-selection" class="grid-alternating-rows n-table-hover n-jqxgrid-table"></div>
    <script>
        $("#table-alternating-row-selection").jqxGrid({
            altRows: true, //alternating rows
            width: '100%',
            height: 200,
            source: dataAdapter,
            pageable:false,
            sortable:false,
            selectionMode:'multiRow', //multi selection
            enableBrowserSelection: false,
            columnsResize:true, //resizable column
            columnsreorder:true, //reorder columns
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            columns: columns,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Standard table with grid lines and cell selection


                                                                          
    <div id="table-grid-cell-selection" class="n-jqxgrid-table"></div>
    <script>
        $("#table-grid-cell-selection").jqxGrid({
            width: 1150,
            height: 200,
            source: dataAdapter,
            editable: true,
            columnsResize: true, //columns resizable
            columnsreorder:true, //reorder columns
            editmode: 'click',
            selectionmode: 'singlecell',
            enableBrowserSelection: false,
            autoshowcolumnsmenubutton: true,
            columns: columns,
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Standard table with grid lines and row selection


                                                                          
    <div id="table-grid-row-selection" class="n-table-hover n-jqxgrid-table"></div>
    <script>
        $("#table-grid-row-selection").jqxGrid({
            width: 1150,
            height: 200,
            source: dataAdapter,
            editable: true,
            columnsResize: true, //column resizeable
            columnsreorder:true, //reorder columns
            editmode: 'click',
            selectionmode: 'singlerow',
            enableBrowserSelection: true,
            columns: columns,
            scrollBarSize: 8,
            rowsheight: 26,
            columnsheight: 26,
            handlekeyboardnavigation: function (e) {
                return $.grid.handlekeyboardnavigation(e);
            }
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Icons in table cells

                                                                          Icons in table cells

                                                                          Description Icons
                                                                          Icon status
                                                                          Icon control

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For icons in table cells components, it will be ok to import following css file :
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          Status icons and clickable icons in table cells have an added background to provide the necessary color contrast in a selected table row or cell.

                                                                          Add n-cell-icon on a div to apply the style.
                                                                          Use the n-cell-icon-container for the default alignment or you can specify your own alignment inside cells. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Icon Status -->
    <td>
        <div class="n-cell-icon-container">
            <div class="n-cell-icon">
                <span class="icon icon-fault-critical"></span>
            </div>
        </div>
    <td>

                                                                          Use n-cell-icon-control for icon control. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Icon Control -->
    <div class="n-cell-icon-container">
        <button class="n-cell-icon-control">
            <span class="icon icon-fault-critical"></span>
        </button>
    </div>

                                                                          Icons

                                                                          Icons in the Nokia icons font. Note, most of the icons are still in draft state.

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For icons components, it will be ok to import following css file :
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          Alert icons

                                                                          Icon Name Code and class
                                                                          Ok "\e600, icon-ok"
                                                                          Error "\e601, icon-error"
                                                                          Info "\e602, icon-info"
                                                                          Warning "\e603, icon-warning"
                                                                          Edited "\e62f, icon-edited"
                                                                          Spinner "icon-spinner"
                                                                          Large spinner "icon-spinner icon-spinner-large"

                                                                          Navigation icons

                                                                          Icon Name Code and class
                                                                          Voice "\e61c, icon-voice"
                                                                          Message "\e60f, icon-message"
                                                                          Data "\e62b, icon-data"
                                                                          Settings "\e618, icon-settings"
                                                                          Settings menu "\e619, icon-settings-menu"
                                                                          Add "\e625, icon-add"
                                                                          Go to "\e607, icon-goto"
                                                                          Dashboard "\e62a, icon-dashboard"
                                                                          Dropdown menu "\e613, icon-dropdown-menu"
                                                                          Back "\e61e, icon-back"
                                                                          First "\e606, icon-first"
                                                                          Last "\e60b, icon-last"
                                                                          Next "\e612, icon-next"
                                                                          Manage "\e614, icon-manage"
                                                                          Calendar "\e901, icon-calendar"
                                                                          Regions "\e616, icon-regions"
                                                                          Corporation "\e628, icon-corporation"
                                                                          Phone "\10c, icon-phone"
                                                                          Profile/user "\e632, icon-profile"
                                                                          Edit "\e62d, icon-edit"
                                                                          Home "\e609, icon-home"
                                                                          Actions menu "\e630, icon-actions-menu"

                                                                          Fault icons

                                                                          Icon Name Code and class
                                                                          Critical "\e629, icon-fault-critical"
                                                                          Major "\e634, icon-fault-major"

                                                                          Warning "\e61b,\e622, icon-fault-warning"

                                                                          Other

                                                                          Icon Name Code and class
                                                                          Breadcrumb "\e61f, icon-breadcrumb"

                                                                          List "\e60c, icon-list"
                                                                          Mandatory field "\e60e, icon-mandatory"

                                                                          arrow right "\e800, icon-right"
                                                                          arrow down "\e802, icon-down"
