                                                                          more horizontal "\e954, icon-more-horiz"

                                                                          Text field

                                                                          Standard text fields

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For text field components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                          Restrictions: Do not use placeholder in disabled text field. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Standard size text field -->
    <label for="Example1" class="control-label">Normal field:</label>
    <input id="Example1" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield" placeholder="Label inside">

    <!-- Disabled text field -->
    <label for="Example2" class="control-label label-disabled">Disabled field:</label>
    <input id="Example2" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield" disabled value="Disabled field">

    <!-- Standard size not-editable text field, e.g. no edit rights -->
    <input class="form-control n-inputfield n-inputfield-uneditable" readonly>

    <!-- Static text -->
    <input class="form-control n-form-control-static" readonly>

    <!-- Clearable text field -->
    <div class="n-inputfield-clearable">
        <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
        <a class="n-inputfield-control-icon hide-element">
            <span role="button" aria-label="clear textfield content" class="icon icon-close"></span>
        </a>
    </div>

    Note: You may initially hide the n-input-control-icon to display it only when there is text inside:
    .hide-element{
        display: none;
    }

                                                                          Small text fields

                                                                          
    <!-- Small text field -->
    <label for="small-example1" class="control-label-sm" style="width: 180px">Normal field:</label>
    <input id="small-example1" class="form-control n-inputfield n-inputfield-small">

    <!-- Small text field not-editable text field, e.g. no edit rights -->
    <input class="form-control n-inputfield n-inputfield-small n-inputfield-uneditable" readonly>

    <!-- Small clearable text field -->
    <div class="n-inputfield-clearable">
        <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield n-inputfield-small">
        <a class="n-inputfield-control-icon n-inputfield-control-icon-small">
            <span class="icon icon-close"></span>
        </a>
    </div>

                                                                          Text fields with indicators

                                                                          Plain with icon

                                                                          Small

                                                                          Disabled normal

                                                                          Disabled small

                                                                          Text field with Mandatory icon() has functionality. Others with indicators will support functionality in future.

                                                                          
    <!-- Basic pattern in the form -->
    <div class="form-group has-feedback">
        <div>
            <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
            <a class="form-control-feedback"><span class="icon icon-input-error"></span></a>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Required field --> class="icon icon-mandatory" feedback type class="input-required"
    <!-- Invalid field --> class="icon icon-input-error" feedback type class="input-error"
    <!-- Changed field --> class="icon icon-edited" feedback type class="input-changed"
    <!-- Valid field --> class="icon icon-ok" feedback type class="input-valid"

    Feedback type can be used with form-group class or with form-control-feedback class

    <!-- Has an error -->
    <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield has-error">

                                                                          Fieldset

                                                                          MME 
                                                                          
    <fieldset class="n-fieldset">
        <legend>MME</legend>
        <label for="address">MME address:</label><input id="address" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield-small">
        <label for="realm">MME realm:</label><input id="realm" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield-small">
        <label for="reattach">Reattach required:</label><input id="reattach" type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield-small">
    </fieldset>

                                                                          Lifecycle

                                                                          EDIT
                                                                          TEST
                                                                          APPROVE
                                                                          DEPLOY
                                                                          ACTIVATE
                                                                          ARCHIVE

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For lifecycle components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.lifecycle.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          
    <div id="lifecycle1">
        <div class="n-lifecycle n-lifecycle-start" >
            <div class="n-lifecycle-content bottom" > </div >
            <div class="n-lifecycle-content top" > <span >START </span > </div >
        </div >
        <div class="n-lifecycle" >
            <div class="n-lifecycle-content bottom" > </div >
            <div class="n-lifecycle-content top" > <span >MIDDEL </span > </div >
        </div >
        ...
        <div class="n-lifecycle n-lifecycle-end" >
            <div class="n-lifecycle-content bottom" > </div >
            <div class="n-lifecycle-content top" > <span >END </span > </div >
        </div >
    </div>

    <!-- Needed scripts -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script>
    $(document).ready(function () {

        var $lifecycle = $("#lifecycle1");
        $(".next").on("click", $lifecycle, function () {
            $lifecycle.find(".n-lifecycle").each(function () {
                if (!$(this).hasClass("selected")) {
                    $(this).addClass("selected");
                    return false;
                }
            });
        });

        $(".previous").on("click", $lifecycle, function () {
            $($lifecycle.find(".n-lifecycle").get().reverse()).each(function () {
                if ($(this).hasClass("selected")) {
                    $(this).removeClass("selected");
                    return false;
                }
            });
        });
    });
    </script>

                                                                          Link

                                                                          Standard

                                                                          Google
                                                                          Google
                                                                          Google

                                                                          Secondary

                                                                          Secondary Google
                                                                          Secondary Google
                                                                          Secondary Google

                                                                          Call to action

                                                                          Google
                                                                          Google
                                                                          Google

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For links components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                          
    <!-- Normal text links -->
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link">Normal link</a>
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-visited">Visited link</a>
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-disabled" disabled>Disabled link</a>
    

                                                                          
    <!-- Secondary text links -->
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-secondary">Secondary link</a>
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-secondary n-link-visited">Visited Secondary link</a>
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-secondary n-link-disabled" disabled>Disabled secondary link</a>
    


                                                                          
    <!-- Call to action text links -->
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-action">Call to action link</a><span class="n-link-action-icon"></span>
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-action n-link-visited">Visited Call to action link</a><span class="n-link-action-icon"></span>
    <a href="http://google.fi" class="n-link n-link-action n-link-disabled" disabled>Disabled call to action link</a><span class="n-link-action-icon"></span>

                                                                          Note1: (Chrome-only) if it is required to get rid of extra underline highlight in case of double-click done after the link/text on the same row, you need to wrap the link/text inside div.

                                                                          Note2: Call-to-action disclosure icon is not acting as hyper link like it should.

                                                                          Note3: It would be better to always add "disabled" property to disabled links especially in IE, however "n-link-disabled" class can work fine without "disabled" property in Chrome and FF.

                                                                          Description list (dl/dt/dd)

                                                                          Example
                                                                          Dapibus ac facilisis in
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Donec lacinia
                                                                          Porta ac consectetur ac
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Vestibulum at eros
                                                                          Donec lacinia
                                                                          Disabled example
                                                                          Dapibus ac facilisis in
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Donec lacinia
                                                                          Porta ac consectetur ac
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Vestibulum at eros
                                                                          Donec lacinia

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For description list (dl/dt/dd) components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.list.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                          Code 
                                                                          
    <!-- Normal list -->
    <dl class="list-group">
        <dt class="list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Cras justo odio</dd>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Nulla vel metus</dd>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Donec lacinia</dd>
        <dt class="list-group-item">Porta ac consectetur ac</dt>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Cras justo odio</dd>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Nulla vel metus</dd>
        <dt class="list-group-item">Vestibulum at eros</dt>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Donec lacinia</dd>
    </dl>

    <!-- Disabled list -->
    <dl class="list-group disabled">
        <dt class="list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Cras justo odio</dd>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Nulla vel metus</dd>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Donec lacinia</dd>
        <dt class="list-group-item">Porta ac consectetur ac</dt>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Cras justo odio</dd>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Nulla vel metus</dd>
        <dt class="list-group-item">Vestibulum at eros</dt>
            <dd class="list-group-item">Donec lacinia</dd>
    </dl>
                                                                          Selection support
                                                                          Dapibus ac facilisis in
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Donec lacinia
                                                                          Dapibus ac facilisis in
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Disabled with selection
                                                                          Dapibus ac facilisis in
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Donec lacinia
                                                                          Dapibus ac facilisis in
                                                                          Cras justo odio
                                                                          Nulla vel metus
                                                                          Code 
                                                                          
    <!-- Normal list with selection -->
    <dl class="n-list-group">
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Nulla vel metus</span></dd>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Donec lacinia</span></dd>
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            ... ...
    </dl>

    <!-- Disabled list with selection -->
    <dl class="n-list-group disabled">
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            ... ...
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            ... ...
    </dl>

    <dl class="n-list-group n-list-group-small">
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Nulla vel metus</span></dd>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Donec lacinia</span></dd>

            ... ...

                                                                          Cras justo odio

    <!-- Scrollable list with selection -->
    <dl class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll">
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Nulla vel metus</span></dd>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Donec lacinia</span></dd>
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            ... ...
    </dl>

    <!-- Disabled scrollable list with selection -->
    <dl class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll disabled">
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>
            <dd class="n-list-group-item"><span>Cras justo odio</span></dd>
            ... ...
        <dt class="n-list-group-item">Dapibus ac facilisis in</dt>

            ... ...
    </dl>

                                                                          Multi-column Lists

                                                                          Standard Multicolumn list
                                                                          Column A Column B Column C
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For multi-column lists components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.list.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                          To make use of the multicolumn list, create a table with the class n-multicolumn-list. 
                                                                          
    <table class="n-multicolumn-list">
    <thead>
    <tr>
    <th>Column A<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th>Column B<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th>Column C<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
    <tr>
    <td><span>Item 1</span></td>
    <td><span>Item 2</span></td>
    <td><span>Item 3</span></td>
    </tr>
    ...
    </tbody>
    </table>

                                                                          Multicolumn list with subheaders
                                                                          Column A Column B Column C
                                                                          Subheader 1
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          Subheader 2
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          Subheader 3
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          To put subheaders, first, make use of the classes in the standard multicolumn list. The tr element must have the class subheader, its first td element occupying the whole row by using the colspan attribute. The items under each subheader must be contained in another tr element with the class subheader-item. 
                                                                          
    <table class="n-multicolumn-list">
    <thead>
    <tr>
    <th>Column A<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th>Column B<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th>Column C<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
    <tr class="subheader">
    <td colspan="3" ><span class="icon icon-next"></span><span>Subheader
    1</span></td>
    </tr>
    <tr class="subheader-item">
    <td><span>Item 1</span></td>
    <td><span>Item 2</span></td>
    <td><span>Item 3</span></td>
    </tr>
    ...
    </tbody>
    </table>

                                                                          Multicolumn rows
                                                                          Column A Column B Column C
                                                                          Item 1 Item 2 Item 3
                                                                          Group Group Item 1 Group Item 1
                                                                          Group Item 2 Group Item 2
                                                                          Group Item 3 Group Item 3
                                                                          Following the template for standard multicolumn lists, create a separate tbody element with the class group. The first td of the group must be of class n-multicolumn-list-td-group. This first td must occupy the whole column in the group by using the rowspan attribute. 
                                                                          
    <table class="n-multicolumn-list">
    <thead>
    <tr>
    <th>Column A<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th>Column B<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th>Column C<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
    <tr>
    <td><span>Item 1</span></td>
    <td><span>Item 2</span></td>
    <td><span>Item 3</span></td>
    </tr>
    ...
    </tbody>
    <tbody class="group">
    <tr>
    <td rowspan="3"><span>Group</span></td>
    <td><span>Group Item 1</span></td>
    <td><span>Group Item 1</span></td>
    </tr>
    ...
    </tbody>
    </table>

                                                                          List with scrollbar DRAFT

                                                                          Normal with stripes
                                                                          Dynamic data
                                                                          • li style
                                                                          • Really really reall
                                                                          
<ul id="dataUl"  class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-striped">
    <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style</span></li>
    <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>Really really reall</span></li>
</ul>
<button class="btn btn-small" onclick="addData()">add data</button>

function addData(){
    var r = Math.round(Math.random()*1000);
    $("#dataUl .mCSB_container").append("<li tabindex='0' class='n-list-group-item'>A" + r + "</li>");
}

                                                                          List with scrollbar

                                                                          Standard

                                                                          Normal
                                                                          Plain list heading
                                                                          • li style list-group-item
                                                                          • Really really really really really really really really really really really really long text
                                                                          • Some item
                                                                          Disabled list
                                                                          • li style list-group-item
                                                                          • Some item
                                                                          • Some text
                                                                          Normal with selection
                                                                          Normal with selection support
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Really really really really really really really really really really really really long text
                                                                          • Example of an item pre-selected
                                                                          Disabled normal with selection
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Really really really really really really really really really really really really long text
                                                                          • Example of an item pre-selected
                                                                          Normal with stripes
                                                                          Alternating / striped with selection support
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Some text
                                                                          • Test 1
                                                                          • Test 2
                                                                          Disabled alternating / striped with selection
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Some text
                                                                          • Test 1
                                                                          • Test 2
                                                                          The more complex lists will actually be done using tables...

                                                                          Small

                                                                          Small
                                                                          Small with selection support
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Really really really really really really really really really really really really long text for testing purposes
                                                                          • Example of an item pre-selected
                                                                          Disabled small with selection
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Really really really really really really really really really really really really long text for testing purposes
                                                                          • Example of an item

                                                                          Dark

                                                                          Dark
                                                                          With selection support
                                                                          • li style n-list-group-item
                                                                          • Really really really really really really really really really really really really long text
                                                                          • Example of an item pre-selected

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For list with scrollbar components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.list.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                          
    <!-- List boxes -->

    <!-- Normal list without selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Plain list heading</span>
    <ul class="list-group n-list-group-scroll">
        <li class="list-group-item">li style list-group-item </li>
        <li class="list-group-item">Some item</li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Disabled normal list -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Disabled normal list</span>
    <ul class="list-group n-list-group-scroll disabled">
        <li class="list-group-item">Some item</li>
        <li class="list-group-item">Another item</li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Normal with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Normal with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Pre-selected item example</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Disabled normal with selection -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Normal with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll disabled">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Pre-selected item example</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Alternating/striped list with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Alternating/striped list with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-striped">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Disabled alternating/striped list with selection -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Disabled alternating/striped list with selection</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll disabled n-list-striped">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Small list with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Small list with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-group-small n-list-striped">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Disabled small list with selection -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Disabled small list with selection</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll disabled n-list-group-small n-list-striped">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Dark list with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Dark list with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-scroll n-list-group-dark">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- The default height of list is 150px. You can change the height by definition of follow style -->
    .n-list-group-scroll{
        height: 200px !important;
    }

                                                                          Subheaders DRAFT

                                                                          Grouped DRAFT

                                                                          Other DRAFT

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For list components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.list.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                          
    <!-- Normal list -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Plain list heading</span>
    <ul class="list-group">
        <li class="list-group-item">li style list-group-item </li>
        <li class="list-group-item">Some item</li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Disabled list -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Disabled list</span>
    <ul class="list-group disabled">
        <li class="list-group-item">Some item</li>
        <li class="list-group-item">Another item</li>
    </ul>
    
                                                                          
    <!-- Normal list with selection -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Normal with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Pre-selected item example</span></li>
    </ul>

    <!-- Disabled list with selection -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header label-disabled">Disabled list with selection</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group disabled">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Pre-selected item example</span></li>
    </ul>
    
                                                                          
    <!-- Striped (alternating) list with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Alternating / striped with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-striped">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item selected"><span>Some text</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>
    
                                                                          
    <!-- Small striped list with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Small with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-small n-list-striped">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>
    
                                                                          
    <!-- Dark list with selection support -->
    <span class="n-list-group-header">Dark with selection support</span>
    <ul class="n-list-group n-list-group-dark">
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>li style n-list-group-item</span></li>
        <li class="n-list-group-item"><span>More text</span></li>
    </ul>

                                                                          Local Navigation

                                                                          WebUI Look & Feel (WULF)
                                                                          • Nemuadmin

                                                                          • |

                                                                          • Log Out
                                                                            HIGH VALUE CUSTOMER INSIGHTS
                                                                          • 16% Policy Control
                                                                          • 16% Policy Control
                                                                          • 16% Policy Control


                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For local navigation components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.navigation.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/wulf.search.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          This local navigation is designed to provide rich visual modeless feedback for each section, helping to direct the user to the most important information first. This is not an area for general information.
                                                                          To use the this, refer to the demo codes: 

                                                                          
<div class="row local-navigation">
    <div class="nav-secondary-horizontal-backgroud"></div>
    <ul class="nav nav-secondary-horizontal">
        <li>
            <a href="#">
                <div class="policy-control-percentage">
                    <span class="n-percentage">16%</span>
                    <span class="n-text">Policy Control</span>
                </div>
                <div class="local-navigation-normal local-nav-percentage-icon">
                    <span class="icon icon-data"></span>
                </div>
            </a>

        </li>
        <li>
            <a href="#">
                <div class="policy-control-percentage">
                    <span class="n-percentage">16%</span>
                    <span class="n-text">Policy Control</span>
                </div>
                <div class="local-navigation-warning local-nav-percentage-icon" >
                    <span class="icon icon-data"></span>
                </div>
            </a>
            <div class="underline-warning"></div>
        </li>
        <li>
            <a href="#">
                <div class="policy-control-percentage">
                    <span class="n-percentage">16%</span>
                    <span class="n-text">Policy Control</span>
                </div>
                <div class="local-navigation-critical local-nav-percentage-icon" >
                    <span class="icon icon-data"></span>
                </div>
            </a>
            <div class="underline-critical"></div>
        </li>
    </ul>
</div>

                                                                          Please involve navbar.js when you use this component.
                                                                          To enable, just require the navbar.js. 

                                                                          
    <script>
    require(['jquery', 'wulf_umd'], function($){
    });
    </script>

                                                                          Localized Sub Navigation

                                                                          Message Boards

                                                                          • Message Board Home
                                                                          • My Posts
                                                                          • New Posts
                                                                          • Settings
                                                                          Content

                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For localized sub navigation components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.drilldown.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.navigation.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                          Gray text links can function as a lower level navigation within the interface. Use nav-local as base for all localized sub navigation. To use normal menu on a panel, use nav-local-menu as a class into the ul. And add nav-local-menu-item for each li. Use nav-local-menu-divided for the version with divider.

                                                                                      
    <!-- Normal localized sub navigation menu-->
    <div class="panel panel-shadow">
        <!-- Panel Heading-->
        <ul class="nav-local nav-local-menu">
            <li class="nav-local-menu-item">
                <a href="#">
                    <span class="icon icon-home"></span>
                    <span>Message Board Home></span>
        <!-- Closing tags -->
    </div>

    <!-- Divided localized sub navigation menu-->
    <ul class="nav-local nav-local-menu-divided">
        <li class="nav-local-menu-item">
            <a href="#">
                <span class="icon icon-home"></span>
                <span>Message Board Home></span>
            </a>
        </li>
    </ul>

    Requires: localized-navigation.js or wulf.js

                                                                          The interactive panel always expands below the selected element. Theinline toolbaris the Additional navigation. The Inline toolbar is a simplified variation on the drill-down pattern. So we use n-drillDown-item. It opens from the bottom of the selected element. So we set the direction as data-target-selector="#item1". We can integrate it with drilldown component and The component should point to the content with id:id="item1". 

                                                                          
<!-- The Inline toolbar of the localized sub navigation menu.-->
<div class="nav-local-inline-toolbar">
   <div class="contents">
     <div class="trigger">
       <h1>Balance</h1>
         <div class="description">Maecenas sed diam ege</div>
         <button class="btn btn-default n-drillDown-item"  data-target-selector="#item1"></button>
     </div>
     <div class="items-icon">
       <ul>
         <li>
           <img src=""../assets/images/wulf.png"">
           <span>Free</span>
         </li>
       </ul>
     </div>
    </div>
</div>
<!-- The drill-down pattern in the Inline toolbar.-->
<div class="nav-local-drilldown">
 <div class="n-drillDown-collapsed" id="item1">
   <div class="n-drillDown-arrowContainer">
    <div class="n-drillDown-arrow"></div>
   </div>
   <div class="n-drillDown-content">
     <div class="n-drillDown-inner">
      <div class="available-components">
       <span>Avaliable components</span>
      </div>
      <div class="items-icon">
        <ul>
         <li>
          <img src="../assets/images/wulf.png">
          <span>Free</span>
         </li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="shared-components">
     <span>Shared components</span>
    </div>
    <div class="items-icon-left">
        <ul>
         <li>
          <img src="../assets/images/wulf.png">
          <span>Free</span>
         </li>
        </ul>
      </div>
  </div>
  <span class="icon icon-close-rounded"></span>
 </div>
</div>
</div>
Requires: localized-navigation.js

                                                                          Localized Sub Navigation

                                                                          Content
                                                                          • Item One
                                                                          • Item Two
                                                                          • Item Three
