                                                                          • Item Six
                                                                          Content

                                                                          Additional navigation may be necessary to access details within panels on a screen. Use the horizontal navigation first, then add the vertical navigation if another layer of information is required. Use nav-local-horizontal for horizontal navigation and nav-local-vertical for vertical navigation. 

                                                                          
    <!-- Horizontal localized sub navigation-->
    <!-- Add nav-local-horizontal-row for the row style-->
    <div class="row nav-local-horizontal-row">
        <ul class="nav-local nav-local-horizontal">
            <li>
                <a href="#">
                    <span>Item One></span>
                </a>
            </li>
        </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Vertical localized sub navigation-->
    <ul class="nav-local nav-local-vertical">
        <li>
            <a href="#">
                <span>Item One></span>
            </a>
        </li>
    </ul>

    To make the left corner radius rounded, add nav-local-vertical-round-left on the ul.
    <!-- Rounded Vertical local sub navigation -->
    <ul class="nav nav-local-vertical nav-local-vertical-round-left">

    Requires: localized-navigation.js or wulf.js

                                                                          Navigation - Horizontal

                                                                          WebUI Look & Feel (WULF)
                                                                          • Nemuadmin

                                                                          • |

                                                                          • Log Out
                                                                          • High Value Consumer Insights
                                                                          • Item One
                                                                          • Item Two
                                                                          • Item Three
                                                                          • Item Four
                                                                          • Item Five
                                                                          • Item Six
                                                                          • Item Seven
                                                                          • Item Eight


                                                                          JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                          For navigation horizontal components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.navigation.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.search.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                          This secondary navigation is an alternative to tab navigation. Unlike tab navigation, secondary navigation acquires a drop shadow when the page scrolls upwards.
                                                                          To use the this, add a row with an n-banner-secondary-row class together with an unordered list with the classnav-secondary-horizontal: 

                                                                          
    <nav class="n-banner">
        ......
        <div class="row n-banner-secondary-row">
            <ul class="nav nav-secondary-horizontal">
                <li>
                    <a href="#">
                        <span>Item One</span>
                    </a>
                </li>
                //More list items
            </ul>
        </div>
    </nav>

                                                                          The condensed product banner can be employed upon scroll in place of the standard banner.
                                                                          To enable, just add some javascript like this on your page to automatically add the class condensed on the banner upon scroll. 

                                                                          
    <script>
        $(document).on('scroll', function() {
            var nBanner = $('.nav-secondary-horizontal').parents('nav.n-banner');

            if($(this).scrollTop()) {
                nBanner.addClass('condensed');
            } else {
                nBanner.removeClass('condensed')
            }
        });
    </script>

                                                                          Navigation - Vertical

                                                                          Navigation title text

                                                                            • Loading...
                                                                            Option 1 - Complex with fuelux tree component (when there is tree-like menu structure needed).
                                                                            Note that example on left is without node item selection support (thus click on it does not cause blue background), only leaves are having action. 
                                                                            
	<!-- Import css style and js file -->
	<!-- NOTICE: always import fuelux.css -->

	<link href="./wulfdist/css/fuelux.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
        <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
        <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
        <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
        <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.navigation.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
	    <link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tree-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
        <link href="demo.css" rel="stylesheet">

	<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
	<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
	<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.min.js"></script>
	<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
	<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
	<script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>
	
                                                                            
	<!-- Vertical navigation component inside panel -->
	<h2 class="secondary-vertical-heading">Navigation title text</h2>
	<div class="panel panel-shadow nav-secondary-vertical">
		<div class="fuelux menu-tree">
			<ul id="myTreeVerticalNav" class="tree" role="tree">
				<li class="tree-branch hide" data-template="treebranch" role="treeitem" aria-expanded="false">
					<div class="tree-branch-header">
						<a class="tree-branch-name">
							<span class="glyphicon icon-caret glyphicon-play"></span>
							<span class="glyphicon icon-folder glyphicon-folder-close"></span>
							<span class="tree-label"></span>
						</a>
					</div>
					<ul class="tree-branch-children" role="group"></ul>
					<div class="tree-loader" role="alert">Loading...</div>
				</li>
				<li class="tree-item hide" data-template="treeitem" role="treeitem">
					<a class="tree-item-name" target="_self">
						<span class="glyphicon icon-item fueluxicon-bullet"></span>
						<span class="tree-label"></span>
					</a>
				</li>
			</ul>
		</div>
	</div>
	
                                                                            
	<!-- Initiate tree data in js -->
	<script>
	$(document).ready( function ()
	{
		$('#myTreeVerticalNav').tree({
			dataSource: dataSource,
			folderSelect :false
		});
		<-- Insert data for tree component -->
		dataSource = function(parentData, callback){//...}

		<-- Optionally define static data for tree component -->
		var childNodesArray = [
			{ "name": "Add WULF", "type": "item", "attr":{"parentNode" : "rootNode", "src" :"#", "id":"start_add"}}
		];
		function staticDataSource(openedParentData, callback) {
			if(typeof openedParentData.attr != 'undefined'){
				callback({
					data: get(childNodesArray,openedParentData.name)
				});
			} else {
				callback({
					data: get(childNodesArray ,"rootNode")
				});
			}
		}
	});
	</script>
                                                                            To disable the tree, you can simply call disable method for the tree component: 
                                                                            
	<span class="demo-highlight-color">$('#myTreeVerticalNav').tree('disable');</span>

                                                                            Navigation title text

                                                                            • Add WULF to project
                                                                            • System Requirements
                                                                            • Third Party SW
                                                                            • FAQ
                                                                            Option 2 - Simple with pure navbar component (when there is no tree-like menu structure needed): 
                                                                            
	<h2 class="secondary-vertical-heading">Navigation title text</h2>
	<div class="panel panel-shadow nav-secondary-vertical">
		<nav class="navbar" role="navigation">
			<ul class="nav navbar-nav">
				<li class="active" id="nav_add">
					<span class="icon icon-bullet"><a><span>Add WULF</span></a></span>
				</li>
				<li id="nav_sys_req">
					<span class="icon icon-bullet"><a><span>System Req</span</a></span>
				</li>
			</ul>
		</nav>
	</div>
                                                                            Javascript for the Option 2 to work: 
                                                                            
	<script>
	$('.nav li').click(function(e) {
		$('.nav li.active').removeClass('active');
		var $this = $(this);
		if (!$this.hasClass('active')) {
			$this.addClass('active');
		}
		e.preventDefault();
	});
	</script>

                                                                            Tabbed pane with Scrollbar

                                                                            • Data A
                                                                            • Data B
                                                                            • Data C
                                                                            • Data D
                                                                            Content inside tab A Content inside tab A Content inside tab A Content inside tab A Content inside tab A Content inside tab A Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab A
                                                                            side tab A Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab B
                                                                            CContent inside tab A
                                                                            b CContent inside tab A
                                                                            ntent inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab CContent inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab A

                                                                            Content inside tab D

                                                                            Note: you need to make the real disabling of this tab via js
                                                                            JS & CSS dependency: 
                                                                            For Tabbed pane with Scrollbar components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tabpane.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
        
                                                                            
<!-- Basic tabs (navs) -->
<ul class="nav nav-tabs">
    <li role="presentation"><a href="#A" data-toggle="tab">Data A</a></li>
    <li role="presentation" class="active"><a href="#B" data-toggle="tab">Data B</a></li>
    <li role="presentation"><a href="#C" data-toggle="tab">Data C</a></li>
    <li role="presentation" class="disabled"><a data-toggle="tab" disabled="disabled">Data D</a></li>
</ul>
<div class="tab-content tab-content-scroll">
    <div class="tab-pane" id="A">Content inside tab A</div>
    <div class="tab-pane active" id="B">Content inside tab B</div>
    <div class="tab-pane" id="C">Content inside tab C</div>
    <div class="tab-pane active" id="D">Content inside tab D</div>
</div>

<!-- JS-script needed -->
<script>
    $(document).ready(function() {
         $(".tab-content-scroll").nScrollbar();
    });
</script>

                                                                            Tabbed pane

                                                                            • Data A
                                                                            • Data B
                                                                            • Data C
                                                                            • Data D
                                                                            Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab B
                                                                            Content inside tab C

                                                                            Content inside tab D

                                                                            Note: you need to make the real disabling of this tab via js
                                                                            JS & CSS dependency: 
                                                                            For Tabbed pane components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.tabpane.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                            If you want to have other than the first tab initially shown, you define: class="active" for the li and div.tab-pane and also a js script to pick it at document loading. 
                                                                            
    <!-- Basic tabs (navs) -->
    <ul class="nav nav-tabs">
    <li role="presentation" class="active"><a href="#A" data-toggle="tab">Data A</a></li>
    <li role="presentation"><a href="#B" data-toggle="tab">Data B</a></li>
    <li role="presentation"><a href="#C" data-toggle="tab">Data C</a></li>
    <li role="presentation" class="disabled"><a data-toggle="tab" disabled="disabled">Data D</a></li>
    </ul>
    <div class="tab-content">
    <div class="tab-pane active" id="A">Content inside tab A</div>
    <div class="tab-pane" id="B">Content inside tab B</div>
    <div class="tab-pane" id="C">Content inside tab C</div>
    <div class="tab-pane active" id="D">Content inside tab D</div>
    </div>
                                                                            • Data A
                                                                            • Data B
                                                                            • Data C
                                                                            • Data D
                                                                            Content inside tab A
                                                                            Content inside tab B
                                                                            Content inside tab C

                                                                            Content inside tab D

                                                                            Note: you need to make the real disabling of this tab via js
                                                                            To add close icon on each tab, add <a href="javascript:void(0)" class="n-close"><span class="icon icon-close"></span></a>
                                                                                     
    <!-- Basic tabs (navs) -->
    <ul class="nav nav-tabs">
    <li role="presentation" class="active"><a href="#dataA" data-toggle="tab">Data A</a><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="n-close"><span class="icon icon-close"></span></a></li>
    <li role="presentation"><a href="#dataB" data-toggle="tab">Data B</a><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="n-close"><span class="icon icon-close"></span></a></li>
    <li role="presentation"><a href="#dataC" data-toggle="tab">Data C</a><a href="javascript:void(0)" class="n-close"><span class="icon icon-close"></span></a></li>
    <li role="presentation" class="disabled"><a data-toggle="tab" disabled="disabled">Data D</a><a href class="n-close"><span class="icon icon-close"></span></a></li>
    </ul>
    <div class="tab-content">
    <div class="tab-pane active" id="dataA">Content inside tab A</div>
    <div class="tab-pane" id="dataA">Content inside tab B</div>
    <div class="tab-pane" id="dataA">Content inside tab C</div>
    <div class="tab-pane active">Content inside tab D</div>
    </div>

                                                                            Panel with scrollbar

                                                                            Available Operations

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title or label

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. dolor
                                                                            JS & CSS dependency: 
                                                                            For Panel with scrollbar components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            You can get basic panel scroll by setting into a div container a class panel-body-scroll: 

                                                                            
  <div class="panel panel-shadow panel-blue-cap">
  <div class="panel-heading">
    <h1>Available Operations</h1>
  </div>
  <div class="panel-body panel-body-scroll">
    ...
  </div>
  </div>
  <script>
    $(document).ready(function(){
      $(".panel-body-scroll").nScrollbar();
    });
  </script>

                                                                            Panel slide Horizontal

                                                                            Configuration groups

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.
                                                                            JS & CSS dependency: 
                                                                            For Panel slide Horizontal components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            panel slide Toggle with Horizontal

                                                                            
<div class="panel-slide-horizontal">
    <div class="panel-left panel panel-shadow">
        <div class="panel panel-blue-cap">
            <div class="panel-heading">
                <h1>Configuration groups</h1>
            </div>
            <div class="panel-body">
            ...
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="panel-arrow panel-blue-cap" role="button" tabindex="0" >
            <span class="icon icon-left"></span>
        </div>
    </div>
    <div class="panel-right">
        <div class="panel-body">
        ...
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

<script>
    $(".panel-slide-horizontal .panel-left .panel-arrow").slideToggleHorizontal({
        isLeftOpen:true,
        leftWidth:40
    });
</script>

                                                                            Panel slide Vertical

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.
                                                                            JS & CSS dependency: 
                                                                            For Panel slide Vertical components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            panel slide Toggle with Vertical

                                                                            
    <div class="panel panel-slide-vertical panel-shadow panel-blue-cap">
    <div class="panel-heading" role="button" tabindex="0">
    <h1>
    <div>
    <span class="icon"></span>
    <label >Commissioning settings</label>
    </div>
    </h1>
    </div>
    <div class="panel-body" id="commissionSettings" style="display: none;" >
    ...
    </div>
    </div>

    <script>
    // isOpen if true body is block
    // speed is 500
    $(".panel-heading").slideToggleVertical({
    isOpen:true,
    speed:500
    });
    </script>

                                                                            Panel

                                                                            Available Operations

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title or label

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. dolor
                                                                            JS & CSS dependency: 
                                                                            For Panel components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.panel.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            You can create a basic panel container by creating a div container with class panel. The panel consists of the panel container, a container for the panel header, as well as a container for the panel content, each with their own class: 

                                                                            
  <div class="panel panel-shadow panel-blue-cap">
  <div class="panel-heading">
    <h1>Available Operations</h1>
  </div>
  <div class="panel-body">
    ...
  </div>
  </div>

                                                                            The panel component also provides a couple of predefined classes for changing the visual appearance of the panel. You can use panel-shadow class to add a drop shadow, as well as panel-blue-cap class to add a blue cap on top of the panel.

                                                                            You can also use predefined sections and single rows to split your panel into distinct parts: 

                                                                            
  <div class="panel-body">

  <div class="panel-section">
    <h2>Title of section</h2>
    ...
  </div>

  <div class="panel-single-row">
    <h2>Title or label</h2>
  </div>

  <div class="panel-section">
    <h2>Title of section</h2>
    ...
  </div>
  </div>

                                                                            Panel variations

                                                                            Available Operations

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. dolor

                                                                            If you wish to use a more streamlined look for a panel, you can create a panel without panel-blue-cap or panel-shadow classes. The "Available Operations" panel shows what a streamlined panel without the drop shadow and the blue cap looks like.

                                                                            Performance Management

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            You can also make the header borderless or transparent by adding panel-heading-transparent to the header. The "Performance Management" panel is an example of such a panel.

                                                                            Preferences

                                                                            Title of section

                                                                            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis vestibulum. Lorem ipsum dolor.

                                                                            You can also use a simpler type of shadow for the panel by substituting panel-shadow with panel-simple-shadow. This is mostly provided as a workaround, as the regular shadow can cause visual glitches when used with very tall panels.

                                                                            Balloon

                                                                            Click the links / buttons below to get the popovers visible (another click will hide it):

                                                                            This is for demonstrating default behavior.
                                                                            This is for demonstrating forced direction popover behavior in button:
                                                                            Demonstrating forced top popover behavior.

                                                                            Demonstrating popover with fadeout in certain time behavior.

                                                                            Example of long text and close icon inside the balloon.
                                                                            Example of a really really really a a a a a a a a a a a a long long long explanation

                                                                            Testing balloon with info button (short text).
                                                                            Short text
                                                                            Testing info button with icon a bit more (short text).
                                                                            Testing info button support hover operation with icon a bit more (short text).
                                                                            Data-placement can be: top | bottom | left | right + also empty + optionally also auto to allow automatic positioning on the opposite side near screen edges. Title should not be used in case of popovers (OT3 does not provide it).
                                                                            You can control the arrow location for example with .popover.right .arrow { top: 22% }
                                                                            Close icon can be added, see the example below.
                                                                            Popover fadeout after show can be added, see the example below.
                                                                            See more for the icon usage in internet.
                                                                            Please note that Nokia GUI rule is to limit the size of tooltip to ONLY 2 lines.

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For balloon components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/wulf.tooltip.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/wulf.balloon.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                            
    <!-- Basic balloon message -->
    Some <a class="link" href data-toggle="popover" data-placement="bottom auto" data-content="explanation text">text</a>
    to explain more with popover.

    <!-- JS-script needed (basic solution) -->
    <script>
        $(function () {
            $('[data-toggle="popover"]').popover()
        })
    </script>


                                                                            
    <!-- Balloon with close icon -->
    <div>
        Example of <a id="myballoon" data-placement="bottom" data-target-selector="#myballoon_text" href="javascript:;"
        class="popover-icon">balloon</a>.
        <div id="myballoon_text" class="hidden">
            <div class="icon-popover-text">Short text
                <a href="javascript:;" class="n-close"><span class="icon icon-close" data-dismiss="modal" aria-label="Close"><span
                aria-hidden="true"></span></span></a>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed (icon version) -->
    <script>
        $('[class="popover-icon"]').popover({
        html: true,
        content: function () {
            return $(jQuery(this).data('target-selector')).html();
        }
        }).on('shown.bs.popover', function (e) {
            var popover = jQuery(this);
            jQuery(this).parent().find('div.popover .n-close').on('click', function (e) {
                popover.popover('hide');
            });
        });
    </script>


                                                                            
    <!-- info button with tooltip and balloon-->
    <div>
    Testing info button
    <a class="link" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom"
    title="Displays file information">
        <button type="button" class="btn btn-info" data-container="body" data-placement="bottom auto"
        data-toggle="popover" href="#nokia_popover" data-html="true"
        data-content="<dl>
            <dt style='clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;'>File name:</dt>
            <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;" >BTS profile_file.file</dd>
            <dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;"> </dt>
            <dt style="clear:left;">Technologies</dt>
            <dt style="clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;" data-reactid=".r.4">GSM:</dt>
            <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;"><span>0</span>
            <span> TRXs</span></dd><dt style="clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;">LTE:</dt>
            <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;"><span>1</span><span> Cells</span></dd>
            <dt style="clear:left;float:left;width:5em;font-weight:normal;" >WCDMA:</dt>
            <dd style="float:left;font-weight:normal;"><span >1</span><span> Cells</span></dd>
            <dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;" data-reactid=".r.a"> </dt>
            <dt style="clear:left;" data-reactid=".r.b">System modules</dt>
            <dd>FSMF</dd><dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;"> </dt>
            <dt>Radio modules</dt>
            <dd>FRGP, FRGS, FXEB</dd><dt style="clear:left;height:0.5em;" > </dt>
            <dt>Extension modules</dt>
            <dd>FBBC</dd></dl>" title="">
        </button></a> with icon a bit more (short text).
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed (icon version) -->
    <script>
        $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
        $('[data-toggle="popover"]').popover();
        $('[data-toggle="popover"]').on('show.bs.popover', function () {
            $(this).parent().tooltip('hide');
        });
    </script>



                                                                            
    <!-- balloon fadeout feature-->

    <!-- JS-script needed  -->
    <script>
        $('.fadeout').on('shown.bs.popover', function () {
            var id="#"+$(this).attr("aria-describedby");

            //the first 1000 means how long the balloon fadeout take, the second 1000 means how long when balloon start fadeout after shown, any number value can be apply
            setTimeout(function(){
                $(id).fadeOut(1000, $.proxy(function(){
                    $(this).popover('hide');
                    }))
            },1000);
    });
    </script>

                                                                            Progress

                                                                            Standard progress

                                                                            0% Complete
                                                                            40% Complete
                                                                            100% Complete
                                                                            30%
                                                                            80%
                                                                            25%
                                                                            100%

                                                                            Loading

                                                                            "icon-spinner icon-spinner-large"
                                                                            "icon-spinner"

                                                                            Verification

                                                                            Working

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For progress components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.progress-bars.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
                                                                            The sr-only class setting for the span hides the percentage showing. The big ok icon is made with the help of bigger heading setting.

                                                                            
    <!-- Progress without value -->
    <div class="progress">
        <div class="progress-bar" id="myid1" role="progressbar" aria-valuenow="40" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100"
        style="width: 40%;">
            <span class="sr-only">40% Complete</span>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Progress with value (OT3 style) -->
    <div class="progress">
        <div class="progress-bar" id="myid2" role="progressbar" aria-valuenow="40" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100"
        style="width: 40%;">
            <span class="progress-value-inverse">40%</span>
        </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Small -->
    <div class="progress progress-small">
    <div class="progress-bar" id="myid4" role="progressbar" aria-valuenow="40" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100"
    style="width: 40%;">
        <span class="progress-value">40%</span>
    </div>
    </div>

    <!-- Indeterminate -->
    <div class="progress n-indeterminate-progress">
    <div class="progress-bar progress-bar-striped active" role="progressbar" aria-valuenow="100" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100">
        <span class="progress-value">100%</span>
    </div>
    </div>

                                                                            Radio button

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For Radio button components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../assets/css/demo.css" rel="stylesheet">
                                                                            
    <!-- Group of radiobuttons -->
    <div class="form-group">
        <label>Label for radiobutton group:</label>
    </div>

    <!--Enabled and checked radiobutton -->
    <div class="radio">
        <input id="id for radiobutton 1" name="name for group of radiobuttons" type="radio" checked>
        <label for="id for for radiobutton 1">Name of the radiobutton 1/label>
    </div>

    <!--Enabled and unchecked radiobutton -->
    <div class="radio">
        <input id="id for radiobutton 2" name="name for group of radiobuttons" type="radio" >
        <label for="id for radiobutton 2">Name of the radiobutton 2/label>
    </div>

    <!--Disabled radiobutton -->
    <div class="radio">
        <input id="id for radiobutton 3" name="name for group of radiobuttons type="radio" disabled>
        <label for="id for radiobutton 3">Name of the radiobutton 3/label>
    </div>

    <!--Small radiobuttons by adding extra class "radio-small" after "radio"-->

                                                                            Text scroll (disabled)

                                                                            Content yx

                                                                            TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT TEXT

                                                                            End of content.

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For Scroll components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                            Add the content needs to scroll under the <div> you use nScrollbar 

                                                                            
    <!-- Main scroll setting -->
    <div id="demo" class="n-scroll">
        <!-- Your content to be scrolled -->
    </div>

                                                                            Vertical text scroll 

                                                                            
    <!-- Vertical text scroll -->
    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script>
        $(document).ready(function () {
            $("#demo").nScrollbar();
        });
    </script>

                                                                            Horizontal text scroll
                                                                            Set the option parameter axis to 'x' in javascript. Set the option parameter advanced: {autoExpandHorizontalScroll: true} in javascript. 

                                                                            
    <!-- Horizontal text scroll -->
    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script>
        $(document).ready(function () {
            $("#demo-x").nScrollbar(
            axis:"x",
            advanced:{autoExpandHorizontalScroll:true});
        });
    </script>

                                                                            Both Vertical and Horizontal scroll at the same time
                                                                            Set the option parameter axis to 'yx' in javascript. Set the option parameter advanced: {autoExpandHorizontalScroll: true} in javascript. 

                                                                            
    <!-- Vertical and Horizontal text scroll -->
    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script>
        $(document).ready(function () {
            $("#demo-yx").nScrollbar({
            axis:"yx",
            advanced:{autoExpandHorizontalScroll:true}});
        });
    </script>

                                                                            Disabled scroll
                                                                            Set the option parameter alwaysShowScrollbar to 2 in javascript. Set the option parameter theme to disabled in javascript. Set the option parameter mouseWheel to enable: false in javascript. Set option parameter disable in nScrollbar() method. 

                                                                            
    <!-- Text scroll(disabled) -->
    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script>
        $("#demo-yx-disabled").nScrollbar({
            axis:"yx",
            advanced:{autoExpandHorizontalScroll:true},
            alwaysShowScrollbar:2,
            theme:"disabled"
            mouseWheel:{ enable: false }
        });
        $("#demo-yx-disabled").nScrollbar("disable");
    </script>

                                                                            Search

                                                                            • Action
                                                                            • Another action
                                                                            • Something else here
                                                                            • Separated link
                                                                            • Action
                                                                            • Another action
                                                                            • Something else here
                                                                            • Separated link
                                                                            • Action
                                                                            • Another action
                                                                            • Something else here
                                                                            • Separated link

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For search components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.links.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.search.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            input element is always present after a and button elements 

                                                                            
    <!-- Standard search box -->
    <div class="n-search">
        <a class="n-search-icon"  >
            <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
        </a>
        <input id="Example1" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Search">
    </div>

    <!-- Search box with drop down -->
    <div class="n-search">
        <a class="n-search-icon dropdown-toggle" href="#" id="dropdownMenu1" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false" >
            <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
            <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
        </a>
        <input id="Example2" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Search">
        <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu" aria-labelledby="dropdownMenu1">
            <li role="presentation">
                <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Action</span></a>
            </li>
            <li role="presentation">
                <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Another action</span></a>
            </li>
            <li role="presentation">
                <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Something else here</span></a>
            </li>
            <li role="presentation">
                <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Separated link</span></a>
            </li>
    </div>

    </ul>
    <!-- Search box with clear selection -->
    <div class="n-search n-search-clearable">
        <a class="n-search-icon" >
            <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
        </a>
        <input id="Example3" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Query">
        <a class="n-search-control-icon" href="#">
            <span class="icon icon-close"></span>
        </a>
    </div>

    <!-- Query with search button -->
    <div class="n-search n-search-action">
        <a class="n-search-icon" >
            <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
        </a>
        <button class="btn n-search-button">Search</button>
        <input id="Example5" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Query">
    </div>

                                                                            • Action
                                                                            • Another action
                                                                            • Something else here
                                                                            • Separated link
                                                                            • Action
                                                                            • Another action
                                                                            • Something else here
                                                                            • Separated link
                                                                            • Action
                                                                            • Another action
                                                                            • Something else here
                                                                            • Separated link

                                                                            Add n-search-disable class to n-search div and disable attribute to the related elements 

                                                                            
    <!-- Standard search box -->
    <div class="n-search n-search-disable">
    <a class="n-search-icon"  >
    <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
    </a>
    <input id="Example1" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Search" disabled>
    </div>

    <!-- Search box with drop down -->
    <div class="n-search n-search-disable">
    <a class="n-search-icon dropdown-toggle" href="#" id="dropdownMenu1" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false"
         disabled>
    <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
    </a>
    <input id="Example2" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Search" disabled>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu" role="menu" aria-labelledby="dropdownMenu1">
    <li role="presentation">
    <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Action</span></a>
    </li>
    <li role="presentation">
    <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Another action</span></a>
    </li>
    <li role="presentation">
    <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Something else here</span></a>
    </li>
    <li role="presentation">
    <a role="menuitem" href="#"><span>Separated link</span></a>
    </li>
    </ul>
    </div>

    <!-- Search box with clear selection -->
    <div class="n-search n-search-clearable n-search-disable">
    <a class="n-search-icon"  disabled>
    <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
    </a>
    <input id="Example3" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Query" disabled>
    <a class="n-search-control-icon"  href="#"  disabled>
    <span class="icon icon-close"></span>
    </a>
    </div>

    <!-- Query with search button -->
    <div class="n-search n-search-action n-search-disable">
    <a class="n-search-icon"  disabled>
    <span class="icon icon-search"></span>
    </a>
    <button class="btn n-search-button">Search</button>
    <input id="Example5" type="text" class="n-inputfield n-search-input" placeholder="Query" disabled>
    </div>

                                                                            Slider

                                                                            Current value of the slider:

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For slider components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.slider.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                            A basic slider is provided for selecting a number from a range of valid numbers. To use the slider, insert an input element with the type range: 

                                                                            
    <input type="range" min="0" max="10">

                                                                            Note that you must include JavaScript to make the slider look and behave correctly, as the browser support for the native input varies. To include the JavaScript dependencies needed for the slider to work, just include wulf.min.js with your page. The script will automatically handle constructing and styling the slider on page load.

                                                                            Listening for changes of the slider value can be done the usual way: 

                                                                            
    $('#slider').on('change input', function() {

    //Do things here with the value of the input slider
    var value = $(this).val();
    });

                                                                            Spinner



                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For spinner components, it will be ok to import following css file:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.spinner.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            For getting the disabled version, add disabled as a class into the top div, <input> tag, <label> tag and <button> tag. Also for the label <label for="mySpinnerDisabled" class="control-label label-disabled">Disabled spinner:</label>
                                                                            For more information about this component, see FuelUX documentation about spinbox. 

                                                                            
    <!-- Basic spinner -->
    <div class="spinner-container">
    <label for="mySpinner" class="control-label">Normal spinner:</label>
    <div class="spinbox" data-initialize="spinbox" id="mySpinner">
    <input id="s-normal" type="text" class="form-control spinbox-input n-inputfield">
    <div class="spinbox-buttons btn-group btn-group-vertical">
    <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-up btn-xs">
    <span class="icon icon-arrow-up"></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Increase</span>
    </button>
    <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-down btn-xs">
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Decrease</span>
    </button>
    </div>
    </div>
    </div>

    <!-- small spinner -->
    <div class="spinner-container">
    <label for="mySpinner" class="control-label">Normal spinner:</label>
    <div class="spinbox n-spinbox-small" data-initialize="spinbox" id="mySpinner">
    <input id="s-normal" type="text" class="form-control spinbox-input n-inputfield">
    <div class="spinbox-buttons btn-group btn-group-vertical">
    <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-up btn-xs">
    <span class="icon icon-arrow-up"></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Increase</span>
    </button>
    <button type="button" class="btn btn-default spinbox-down btn-xs">
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
    <span class="sr-only">Decrease</span>
    </button>
    </div>
    </div>
    </div>

    <!-- JS-script needed -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <script>
    $('#mySpinner').spinbox();
    $('#mySpinnerDisabled').spinbox();
    $('#mySmallSpinner').spinbox();
    $('#mySmallSpinnerDisabled').spinbox();

    //for disabled version
    $('#mySpinnerDisabled').off("mousedown");
    $('#mySmallSpinnerDisabled').off("mousedown");
    </script>

                                                                            Modify the width of spinner input in CSS:

                                                                            
    .spinbox .spinbox-input {
    width: 200px;
    }

                                                                            Splitter

                                                                            Vertical splitter

                                                                            Area 1
                                                                            Area 2

                                                                            Horizontal splitter

                                                                            Area 1
                                                                            Area 2

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For splitter components, import following css files:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/jqx.base.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.splitter.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

                                                                            To use the splitter, see more details from the jqxSplitter documentation. 

                                                                            <!-- Standard splitter (from jqxWidgets) -->
<div id="mySplitterVert" class="n-splitter">
    <div>Area 1</div>
    <div>Area 52</div>
</div>

                                                                            <script src="../wulfdist/js/jquery.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/jqxcore.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/jqxsplitter.js"></script>

<script>
var panels = [{size: 100, collapsible: false}, {collapsible: false}];

<!-- Vertical splitter -->
$('#mySplitterVert').jqxSplitter({height: 200, width: 300, panels: panels});

<!-- Horizontal splitter -->
$('#mySplitterHoriz').jqxSplitter({height: 200, width: 300, orientation: 'horizontal', panels: panels});
</script>

                                                                            Table with errors

                                                                            Supports OT3 Specification (aug-2014) page 153.


                                                                            Scroll table with error header row

                                                                            With icon With text With editable cell Checkbox cell Dropdown cell With error/alert With number
                                                                            There are 6 errors in this table.
                                                                            		Critical fault
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Five Five Five
                                                                            		2010 910
                                                                            		Major fault
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Five Five Five
                                                                            		2010 910
                                                                            		Minor fault
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Five Five Five
                                                                            		2010 910
                                                                            		Warning
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Five Five Five
                                                                            		2010 910
                                                                            		Fault cleared
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Five Five Five
                                                                            		2010 910
                                                                            		Unknown situation
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Five Five Five
                                                                            		2010 910

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For table with errors components,you can use following css import code:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.table-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
        
                                                                            
    <!-- Scroll table with error header row -->
    <table class="n-table n-table-standard n-table-striped n-table-cell-hover n-table-error">
    <thead>
    <tr>
    <th class="n-sortable">With icon
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
    </th>
    <th class="n-sortable">With text
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span>
    </th>
    <th>With editable cell</th>
    <th>Checkbox cell</th>
    <th>Dropdown cell</th>
    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With error/alert
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With number<span class="icon icon-arrow"></span></th>
    </tr>
            
            <tr>
                <th colspan="7"> <!-- The colspan should be the number of the column in table
    -->
                    <span><span class="icon icon-error"></span>There are 6 errors in this table.</span>
                    <span class="icon icon-close-rounded"></span>
                </th>
            </tr>
            
    </thead>
    <tbody>...<tbody>
    </table>

    <th>Checkbox cell</th>
    <th>Dropdown cell<span class="icon text-center n-error-indicator">100</span></th>
    <th class="text-right n-sortable">With error/alert
    <span class="icon icon-arrow"></span><span class="icon text-center n-error-indicator">6</span></th>

    </tr>

    </table>

                                                                            Tables with filters

                                                                            When filters are present, they are displayed in a tall row directly under the column heads. Filters can be cleared individually or they can all be cleared at once with a single click. There will be filter result information at the bottom if filter is working.

                                                                            Column1 Column2 Column3
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Four
                                                                            • Five
                                                                            • Six
                                                                            • Option1
                                                                            • Option2
                                                                            • Option3
                                                                            • Option4
                                                                            • Option5
                                                                            • Option6
                                                                            • Critical fault
                                                                            • Major fault
                                                                            • Minor fault
                                                                            • Warning
                                                                            • Fault cleared
                                                                            • Unknown situation
                                                                            One Option1 Critical fault
                                                                            Two Option2 Major fault
                                                                            Three Option3 Minor fault
                                                                            Four Option4 Warning
                                                                            Five Option5 Fault cleared
                                                                            Six Option6 Unknown situation
                                                                            Results: 534 Total: 5237

                                                                            JS & CSS dependency:

                                                                            For table with filters components,you can use following css import code:
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.basic.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.buttons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.combobox.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.dropdowns.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.inputfield.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="../wulfdist/css/wulf.table-normal.min.css" rel="stylesheet">

                                                                            Source code for table content: 

                                                                            
    <!-- HTML -->
    <table class="n-table n-table-standard n-table-striped n-table-hover n-table-filter">
    <thead>
    <tr>
    <th>Column1<span class="icon icon-filter"></span></th>...<th></th>
    </tr>
    <tr>
    <th>
                    <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox" data-resize="auto" data-initialize="combobox" id="myCombobox1">
                        <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
                        <a class="n-filter-clear-control"><span class="icon icon-close"></span></a>
                        <div class="input-group-btn">
                            <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
                            <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right n-dropdown-menu-scroll">
                                <li data-value="1"><a href="javascript:void(0);"><span>One</span></a></li>
                                <li data-value="2"><a href="javascript:void(0);"><span>Two</span></a></li>
                                <li data-value="1"><a href="javascript:void(0);"><span>Three</span></a></li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                    </div>
    </th>
    ...
    <th><span class="icon icon-close-rounded"></span></th>
    </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>...</tbody>
    <tfoot>
    <tr>
    <td colspan="4">
    <div class="n-table-total has-filter">
                        <span class="icon icon-filter"></span>
                        <span class="n-table-filter-result">Results: <span>534</span></span>
                        <span>Total: <span>5237</span></span>
    </div>
    </td>
    </tr>
    </tfoot>
    </table>

    <!-- Javascript -->
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
    <script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

    <script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
    $('#myCombobox1').combobox();
    $(".n-dropdown-menu-scroll").nScrollbar();
    });
    </script>

                                                                            The following example show filter result and page informationi at the same time

                                                                            Column1 Column2 Column3
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Four
                                                                            • Five
                                                                            • Six
                                                                            • Option1
                                                                            • Option2
                                                                            • Option3
                                                                            • Option4
                                                                            • Option5
                                                                            • Option6
                                                                            • Critical fault
                                                                            • Major fault
                                                                            • Minor fault
                                                                            • Warning
                                                                            • Fault cleared
                                                                            • Unknown situation
                                                                            One Option1 Critical fault
                                                                            Two Option2 Major fault
                                                                            Three Option3 Minor fault
                                                                            Four Option4 Warning
                                                                            Five Option5 Fault cleared
                                                                            Six Option6 Unknown situation
                                                                            Results: 534 Total: 5237
                                                                            Page/ 255
                                                                            • 1
                                                                            • 2
                                                                            • 3
                                                                            Items per page

                                                                            Source code for table content: 

                                                                            
<!-- HTML -->
<table class="n-table n-table-standard n-table-striped n-table-hover n-table-filter">
<thead>...</thead>
<tbody>...</tbody>
<tfoot>
<tr>
<td colspan="4">
    <div class="n-table-total has-filter">
                        <span class="icon icon-filter"></span>
                        <span class="n-table-filter-result">Results: <span>534</span></span>
                        <span>Total: <span>5237</span></span>
    </div>
    <div class="n-table-pagenum">
        <button class="btn btn-icon">
        <span class="icon icon-first"></span>
        </button>
        <button class="btn btn-icon">
        <span class="icon icon-back"></span>
        </button>
        <span>Page</span><input id="Example1" type="text" class="n-inputfield" placeholder="1"><span>/255</span>
        <button class="btn btn-icon">
        <span class="icon icon-next"></span>
        </button>
        <button class="btn btn-icon">
        <span class="icon icon-last"></span>
        </button>
    </div>

    <div class="n-table-pageselect">
        <div class="n-table-pagecombox">
            <div class="input-group input-append dropdown combobox n-page-combox" data-initialize="combobox" id="myCombobox1">
            <input type="text" class="form-control n-inputfield">
                <div class="input-group-btn">
                <button type="button" class="btn btn-default dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown">
                <span class="caret"></span></button>
                    <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right" role="menu">
                        <li data-value="1"><a href="javascript:void(0);"><span>1</span></a></li>
                        <li data-value="2"><a href="javascript:void(0);"><span>2</span></a></li>
                        <li data-value="3"><a href="javascript:void(0);"><span>3</span></a></li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

        <div class="n-table-suffix">
            <span>Items per page</span>
        </div>
    </div>
</td>
</tr>
</tfoot>
</table>

<!-- Javascript -->
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/fuelux.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mousewheel.min.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/dependencies/jquery.mCustomScrollbar.js"></script>
<script src="../wulfdist/js/wulf.min.js"></script>

<script>
$(document).ready(function () {
$('#myCombobox1').combobox();
$(".n-dropdown-menu-scroll").nScrollbar();
});
</script>

                                                                            Scroll table with filters

                                                                            Option to show only gray filter icon at the bottom if the filter is supported but not used.

                                                                            Column1 Column2 Column3
                                                                            • One
                                                                            • Two
                                                                            • Three
                                                                            • Four
                                                                            • Five
                                                                            • Six
                                                                            • Option1
                                                                            • Option2

                                                                            • Option4
                                                                            • Option5
                                                                            • Option6

                                                                            • Unknown situation

                                                                            Five Option5 Fault cleared
                                                                            Six Option6 Unknown situation
                                                                            One Option6 Unknown situation
                                                                            Two Option6 Unknown situation 
                                                                            
    <!-- Standard table with scrollbar -->
    <table class="n-table">
    <thead>...</thead>
    <tbody class="n-table-scrollbar">...</tbody>
    <tfoot>
    <tr>
    <td colspan="4">
    <div class="n-table-total no-filter">
    <span class="icon icon-filter"></span>
    <span class="n-table-filter-result">Results: <span>534</span></span>
    <span>Total: <span>5237</span></span>
    </div>
    </td>
    </tr>
    </tfoot>
    <tbody>
    </table>

                                                                            		Critical fault
